boardgame.name: Shimiagaran
boardgame.description:
Shimiagaran are a forgotten breed of ancient scientists, wiped out from history by the cruel alchemists, out of jealousy, despite, and greed. The beliefs of mainstream alchemy could not bear the thought of another group beating them to the elixir of life. Hence, they got the kingdoms to support them, announced the elixir of life impossible, and denied the existence of Shimiagaran.

"Shimiagaran" is a play on the word "alchemists" in Farsi, something like "Alchemystery" if you will.

Shimiagaran is a competitive push your luck and resource management family game. In this game, players have to gather the necessary ingredients for concocting Light and Dark Potions. Ingredients are distributed in two separate sacks at the start of the game: the White Sack, and the Black Sack, which include a different number of Tarantulas. The White Sack has a drafting mechanism, and the Black Sack has a push your luck mechanism. After gathering the required ingredients and making the necessary potions, players can mix their potions to make legendary Elixirs.

Each player has 3 containers: a bottle to keep liquid ingredients in (white and red), a mortar to keep the plant ingredients in (green and pink), and a bag to keep mineral ingredients in (blue and yellow). Each container can hold a total of 5 cubes, and tarantulas can be kept in any container. At the beginning of the game, the white sack has many ingredients and few tarantulas, and the black has few ingredients and many tarantulas. As the game goes on and players take action, all the cubes, including tarantulas circulate between the two sacks.

On a player's turn they can perform one of the following actions:
Take cubes from one of the sacks or Make a potions or elixirs for Victory Points.

Players keep their cards beside their player board, and the amount of VP any player has is public. When one player surpasses the 30VP, the game ends after 2 more rounds.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Alakazum! 2
boardgame.description:
Alakazum 2 is an expansion for the game Alakazum! Witches and Traditions with 70 additional cards. As in the core game, players need to gather different characters of the same culture, level them up and, finally, use their power to defeat one of the dangerous American traditions. This expansion includes a new final boss called “Armazon”, which is invincible. Additional characters with new powers are included in this expansion, for example those who come from Castilla and Madrid. The Miserable Witch Pot is also a highlighted new card that will help the players who are losing the game.

The expansion also includes a new game mode: the challenge mode. Advanced players may take a challenge random at the beginning of the game. In this mode they will need to achieve a special goal if they want to win the game.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Samsara: Das Rad der Wiedergeburten
boardgame.description:
The game teaches themes from Buddhism and rebirth.

Basically, it's a race in which you want to be the first to reach space 64 (single victory). Since the game is played in 2 groups, there is also a group victory when all members of the group reach space 64.

A player rolls the dice and may - depending on the current special rule - move on, take a black or white stone, jump to a certain square. take an event card, etc. White stones can be exchanged for a stupa, which provides an aid to rebirth (restart). White and black stones may not be taken to the target field and must be worked off by sitting out.

In addition to the game instructions, the game box also contains a manual with a detailed explanation of the individual fields and their meaning in Tibetan Buddhism.

boardgame.name: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 4 – Cambalache
boardgame.description:
Sucesos Argentinos Vol. 4 is a card game where Argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 4 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes. It can be combined with other volumes to play up to 6 players.

This game box contains 75 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 4 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos. Puede combinarse con otros volúmenes para permitir hasta 6 jugadores.

La caja del juego contiene 75 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

boardgame.name: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – Game Tamer Organizer
boardgame.description: This organizer insert is designed for Twilight Imperium 4th Edition with Prophecy of Kings expansion. It greatly improves set-up and tear-down times. Trays can be utilized during gameplay to keep everything tidy on the table allowing to focus on the gameplay. Supports sleeved cards and even with Prophecy of Kings expansion box lid closes flush. Has enough space for Codex I and II cards.

boardgame.name: Wingspan + European and Oceania expansion: Game Tamer Organizer
boardgame.description: Game Tamer organizer provides a beautiful nest for all your favorite birds! A practical and elegant way to store all components is a must for such an astonishing-looking game! Free your habitats of plastic once and for all with our new Wingspan organizer insert! Oh, and by the way, if You have any of the expansions, don't worry, they will fit in the same box! And did we mention that no assembly is required?

2. Tray with 3 sections for buttons, a section for special patches and tokens and a "pocket" for 7x7 achievement.

Tame your game with this HDF box organizer insert compatible with Arkham Horror (3rd edition) + Dead of Night, Under Dark Waves and Secrets of the Order expansions.
WHAT YOU GET:

boardgame.name: Ram vs. Stag: The Battle of Bir el Gubi, November 19, 1941
boardgame.description:
“…an encounter battle carried out too enthusiastically against prepared positions…not seen or recognized until the attack had been launched.” –Summary of the British attack at Bir el Gubi by Lieutenant General Willoughby Norrie.

Ram vs. Stag is a low complexity war game simulation of the first battle fought near the village and oasis at Bir el Gubi in Libya. In response to General Erwin Rommel’s bold offensive the British-led Allied forces launched a counter offensive to defeat the Axis forces that were besieging Tobruk. Dubbed Operation Crusader, the Allied attack was launched on November 18th and caught the Axis by surprise. However, Rommel reacted quickly by withdrawing his armored forces into an arc that stretched south and west of the crucial port. The British armored units groped their way forward attempting to identify and fix their enemy’s positions. Late on November 18th units of the Italian Ariete (Ram) Division were discovered near the village of Bir El Gubi. The 22nd Armored Brigade (Stags), a recently deployed unit to the North Africa, was ordered to attack. In the past, British tanks had sent the Italians into head-long flight and a repeat was expected. Instead, the Italians had dug in and were prepared to fight.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counter parts? Lean and enjoy!

Each turn of the game represents one hour of time. Each hex is approximately a third of a mile across. Units represent companies of men (infantry), batteries of 4-6 guns (artillery and AT), or 10-12 vehicles (tanks and armored cars).

Each copy of Ram vs. Stag is composed of the following:

8 pages of rules
Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets with game tracks and tables
160 single sided, un-mounted counters

Players will also need a six sided die and an opaque container (mug, envelope or anything similar) to play the game.

Each turn of the game represents one hour of time. Each hex is approximately a third of a mile across. Units represent companies of men (infantry), batteries of 4-6 guns (artillery and AT), or 10-12 vehicles (tanks and armored cars).

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of Ram vs. Stag.
Mounted counters can be had for an additional $8.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: You Must Be Bunkers
boardgame.description:
The world is ending and you and a group of like minded individuals have a bunker to live out the apocalypse.
However, there are people wanting to join you in your bunker, but there is limited space. You and your group must decide who is worthy to join.

You Must Be Bunkers is a 3 to 5 player party game where the objective is to take turns to recruit the "best" candidates to join your bunker to live out the apocalypse. The objective of the game is to get the people you deem worthy into the bunker before it reaches maximum capacity.

Each player gets dealt 3 cards from the each deck. This is your hand. One player is then chosen as the leader for the first round, this can be done by playing rock, paper, scissors or flipping a coin or just picking at random.

It is the leader's job to listen to all the other players and decide who gets to stay in the bunker. It is up to the remaining players to convince the leader to choose their person, by any means necessary. The person the leader chooses stays in the bunker and the player that convinced the leader to pick their person gets a ration.

After the leader has chosen a card and a ration has been given, the leader changes from player to player going around clockwise, you then repeat until you fill the bunker.

The game ends when you have 10 people (including the players) in the bunker. The player with the most rations is the winner!

boardgame.name: Holzwurm-Wurfelspiel
boardgame.description:
Players create a worm (in the first place you receive its head) by adding colorful body-pieces according with the throw of one dieby adding pieces that match the color of the die. The same colors can;t be side by side, so if a player rolls the same color twice, they lose their turn.

The game ends when the pieces are all distributed,. The player with the longest worm is the winner.

boardgame.name: Champions of Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kneel before the Champions of Death!

Warhammer Age of Sigmar Soulbound Champions of Death allows players to create tragic, damned, and twisted undead characters for Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound! The book features new undead Species, new Archetypes, new Talents, and devastating new spells and Miracles. Champions of Death Includes:

Insight into the Great Necromancer Nagash, his history with the Soulbound, and why he may deign to forge a deathly Binding with his own skeletal hands.
Rules to play as horrifying Ghouls, skeletal Wights, vindictive Soulblight Vampires, spectral Nighthaunts, or powerful Ossiarch Bonreapers, as well as advice on how and why your character became Soulbound and dozens of sample Short- and Long-term Goals.
20 new Death-focused Archetypes such as the Vampire Lord and Knight of Shrouds, as well as rules for playing sub-factions such as the Blisterskin of the Flesh-eater Courts, the Mortis Preatorians of the Ossiarch Bonereapers, the Vyrkos Dynasty of the Soulblight Gravelords, and many more!
Over 50 new Talents, 10 powerful new Miracles of Nagash, and 50 new spells drawn from the twisted Lores of Magic wielded by the undead — including five terrifying new Endless Spells!
Over 30 new Endeavours for undead characters to undertake, as well as new Dark Rituals to unleash on your foes — host a grand feast of the Flesh-eater Courts, bestow the Blood Kiss of the Soulblight Vampires, or raise a horde of zombies to do your bidding!
Advice for Gamemasters and players on running Death-focused campaigns, as well as statistics for over a dozen servants of the Forces of Order for your Champions of Death to face!

boardgame.name: Depredadores: Cazando en la Isla
boardgame.description:
The predators face off in a night scene where the most agile and fastest survives. Jaguars hunt alligators, curiyú, owls and toads, while spider web traps and the smell of skunks turn the game into chaos.

Includes 2 game modes: Hunting on the Island and Gathering Herds.

Hunting on the Island

With the agility of predators and knowledge of the species, protect the weakest animal on the island and take all the cards. You have to be very attentive, the fastest hunter wins!

Deal all cards among players, who will leave them in a face-down pile. At the same time, all players reveal their first card. The first player to cover the weakest animal on the food chain and shout its name, wins the round and take all cards. There are also some special actions cards that could change conditions for the round.

When all cards were played, the player with the most cards, wins.

Gathering Herds

To survive on the island, cunning and agility are essential. Group the animals by species and use all your speed to win the game.

Deal 5 to 7 cards to each player (according to the number of players). Leave the rest of the cards in a face-down deck in the middle.

The dealer signals the start, and each player, at the same time, can:

Put down a pair of equal cards.
Put down a card equal to a pair another player put down.
Take cards from the middle deck to form pairs.


When a player is out of cards, the round finishes. Each player gets 1 point per card left in their hand.

At the end of the fifth round, the game ends and the lowest score wins.

boardgame.name: Los Teros: Vuelo Rasante
boardgame.description:
The teros will use the weapons that nature's design gave them to take care of their nest exposed to the most voracious predators (hawks, gulls, owls, snakes, weasels, cats and dogs).

A card war... with Teros! Los Teros: Vuelo Rasante is a card game for 2 players in which one player will be the Teros, and the other the Predators. The objective of the teros is to take care of their nests and their territory, and that of the predators to reach the eggs. That is why, throughout 3 game difficulty modes (easy, normal and expert), the one who places the best card and wins a majority of battles may be the winner of the game.

On their turns, players simultaneously show a card. The player with the highest card wins.

The game ends when all cards have been played and the person with the highest number of tricks wins the game.

boardgame.name: BATTALIA: Hero Sheets
boardgame.description:
The Hero sheets introduce unique powers to the different heroes in the game. Each hero has 3 own special abilities (skills) separated in 3 levels. All first level abilities can be used once per turn for free and are equal for the male and female character of every faction. All level 2 and 3 abilities need to be activated in order to be used and may be played several times per turn as long as the player has resources (supply cards) to activate them. They are specific for every single hero.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Las Abejas: Color Miel
boardgame.description:
The bees will show us their unprecedented wisdom and a cooperative social organization designed around the production of honey and above all, as a daily task that is incumbent on all the beings of this planet, to maintain the ecological balance through this activity so important as is pollination.

Build your games by gathering prayers and honey. Ask your opponents if they have that card you are looking for or fly to the garden to find it. The bee that forms the most groups of ores and honey wins the game.

It includes 2 game modes.


¡Volá!

Distribute to each player 7 cards for a 2 player game, or 5 cards for a 3 or 4 player game. The remaining cards are spread face down on the table, forming a garden shared by all players.

The objective of the game is to build sets of 3 cards of the same type (ores or honey) and number to play.

The first player takes a card from the garden and adds it to his hand. Then they must ask any player for a number and type of card, seeking to build a set of 4 with the ones he already owns.

Now, the player who was asked has two options:

If he possesses one or more of that number and type, he must give it to him.
If he does not have any cards of the type sought, he must answer: Fly!


The requesting player will then remove a card from the garden.

If the card obtained from the garden matches the one you requested earlier, you must show it to the rest of the players and you can continue asking the others.
If it does not match, it will be the turn of the player to his right.


When a player gathers 3 cards of the same type and number, he will place them face up to one side. The game ends with the first player who manages to play all their cards.

The player who has managed to form the most groups wins.


Color Miel

Immerse yourself in the universe of bees, where order and work are the fundamental tools to achieve the best and richest honey. Among flowers and beehives, you must be attentive to the numbers and colors to build your game. Use the speed and agility of the bees to lower all your cards and thus win the game.

Deal 14 cards to each player. The first player takes a card from the deck and adds it to the ones he has.

They can now:

If they have the Queen, you must lower her immediately and place her in the middle. Take another card from the pot.
If the Queen is not lowered, you cannot go down beehive games or honey ladder, but you can go down a bouquet or flower ladder.
If you can't do any of the above, you must pass.


The next player on the right follows, always taking a card from the pot and placing it next to their cards. On their turn, the player is entitled to perform any of the actions above or:

Add a letter or more to a ladder, or complete a bouquet or beehive on the table.
Draw a card from a game for another player that does not make it lose its status as a bouquet, hive or ladder, and use the drawn card to open a new game.


The game ends when one of the players closes by lowering all his cards. The other players must add up the value of the cards they have in their hand. Four games make up the game. The player with the fewest points will be the winner.

boardgame.name: Gas Station Simulator
boardgame.description:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1149620/Gas_Station_Simul...

Gas Station Simulator is all about renovating, expanding and running a gas station along a highway in the middle of a desert. Freedom of choice and multiple approaches to run your business and deal with pressure are key ingredients in this game.

Buy an abandoned gas station in the middle of nowhere and restore it to its former glory. Get rid of debris and broken furniture, fix up the walls, paint and decorate the place to your liking.
Just don’t spend all your cash on the looks right away, you bought a gas station after all. Repair the equipment, buy what can’t be repaired and start serving your customers to earn money for further renovations and improvements.

You don’t need to stay small. You can expand your gas station to be able to serve more customers. Also, a gas station is not just about selling fuel. You can expand the array of services that you offer to your customers and thus attract more and more varied customers.
You have various expansion options at your disposal, from smaller ones like providing toilets, a simple shop to complement your income up to big ones like an entire workshop to perform car repairs or even a car wash. There are quite a few choices and most of the expansions can themselves be further expanded upon as well. There is so much you can do here.

Restoring your gas station is one thing, giving it a personal touch another. The game offers a wide array of options to customize what you have already built and lots of decorations to further enhance the uniqueness of the place. Some decorations can be bought, others have to be acquired during gameplay.

It is not just about making the gas station look nice. The more impressive your gas station looks, the more customers will be attracted.

Serving your customers is key in running your gas station with success. They all expect to have their cars filled up, their shopping done right away and aren’t that patient even when it comes to repairs of their vehicles. You are going to be dealing with some serious time pressure at peak hours and have to schedule various tasks for when it’s less hectic. Proper time management and choosing the right priorities becomes very important when it comes to keeping your customers happy.

While you can try, it most cases running a gas station that has been expanded and upgraded offering lots of different services to your customers might be just too much to handle for you alone. This is where employees come into play. You can hire even multiple employees to help you with the various tasks at the gas station. Employees have their own skills and some are better at some tasks than others. Employees also level based on the tasks they perform and become better at them with time.

You can’t sell what you don’t have. Keeping track of your stock is important and ordering at the right time for the right price helps to keep profits up. To even better use low price opportunities, you can build a warehouse and expand it to allow for larger storage. Keeping a close eye on your stock is crucial as deliveries take time and you really don’t want to run out of goods to sell, not to mention fuel.

We created the game so that if you like, you can dive deep into management features and micromanage the living you know what out of it. However, if micromanaging isn’t your cup of tea, we don’t force you to deal with the depths of it. That being said, micromanaging some aspects like supplies or employees can be very rewarding both in terms of finances and fun.

boardgame.name: Hormigas: Cavando entre Túneles
boardgame.description:
The ants, as present as invisible in our daily lives, will wage a bid between obstacles and impediments, to form a colony larger than that of their rivals, connecting underground paths and above all teaching us, while we play, what this important work is about as tiny.


Cavando entre Túneles

Players play ants and are trying to dig a set of tunnels to reach the queen. The road can get complicated if obstacles appear, but in the end, the ants always reach their goal.

On each turn, players use cards to build tunnels to their queen and place obstacles in the other players paths. You must end your turn with exactly five cards in hand. Only one card can be played per turn.

The game continues until one player manages to lower the minimum number of tunnels, in order to place the queen at the end of the course and thus win the game (as long as all the cards are connected). As soon as you have played the required number of cards in a continuous line, you can add your queen to the end of this line in the same turn and win the game!


Hormiguero Infinito

From top to bottom or from bottom to top, connect the paths of the underground maze and create your own anthill. You are going to enjoy a game without limits and with infinite possibilities.


Trabajo de Hormiga

Collecting 100 ants for your anthill is not easy. To form this colony successfully you always have to start with La Reina. While working both on the surface and in the humid tunnels, you will have to be careful of the obstacles that will stop them.
your progress in the game.

On their turn, players must lay down a queen cards and then add tunnel card and ant cards totalling up to 100 ants. Or they can try to sabotage their opponents by playing obstacle cards.

ATTENTION: If the queen is not lowered, cards cannot be downloaded from tunnels or grass, since a colony does not exist without it. Once she is there, those cards are lowered until an obstacle is presented. Whoever has one in their anthill cannot continue to download cards until they solve it with the corresponding card.


The first player to solve all their obstacles and add more than 100 ants to their lowered cards will be the winner.
There are no more cards in the deck and the players have discarded all the cards in their hand, or that no one can bring down more cards, because the game is blocked. In this case, the dropped ants must be added, and whoever gets the most wins.

boardgame.name: Evershift
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to what remains of the Feywild.

Welcome to the Evershift.

In this adventure, you'll take a party of heroes into ancient forests, encounter strange & deadly creatures therein, and parley with its desperate matriarchs. The adventure designed for a level 4-6 party and makes use of the 5e Open Gaming License.

Evershift can be ran as a 1-shot or as a continuation of the events from Motherlode and was created as part of the Drifter's Atlas community live streaming events.

boardgame.name: Río Profundo: Pesca Vertiginosa
Río Profundo: Una Pesca Vertiginosa
boardgame.description:
Deep river, mysterious because of the brown that covers it in the eyes of those of us who live above, hides thousands of species that coexist in that muddy and mighty ecosystem, where silver beings swim with the current looking for small prey and escaping from the larger ones.

Fish, predators and birds are confused with canoes, rods and the odd lost shoe in this exciting search game that will take your breath away. Accumulate as many letters as you can by responding to the search prompts. Become the best fisherman on the Paraná River, finding the species or lost objects that the cards ask you to win a race played at the speed of the current.

Place all the river cards on the table face up in the way you prefer. Place the stacked slogan cards face down.

Take a card from the deck of slogans. The player on the left is asked to call out a number from 1 to 6. The mentioned number will show what and how much the player has to catch. If the number you touch is the one with a picture, "Everyone should search at the same time." The first to find it wins.

If the player points to a drawing that does not correspond at all to the mission, they will lose a turn.

If the player completes the mission in less than 30 seconds, he keeps the slogan card. If it fails, it puts it at the bottom of the deck.

The winner will be the player who has won the most cards after four rounds.

boardgame.name: Savage Sisters
boardgame.description:
A narrative sword and sorcery RPG about powerful women making a difference in a barbaric world.

Savage Sisters is a game for multiple players. Together the group creates their Sodal – a group of powerful, warrior women who are bound together in sisterhood (whether that be through family blood or shared purpose).

boardgame.name: Golondrinas: Un Periplo con Alas
boardgame.description:
The swallows must put all their skills to the test to achieve their migratory goal, flying from one nest to another on a long and tireless journey towards eternal summer.

Includes 3 game modes: Viaje con Alas, Golondrina Tramposa y Pares de Plumas


Viaje con Alas

Spread your wings to join the swallows' journey, in search of food and warmth. Get to know the different species of these birds to group them and build the journey that takes them to their nest of arrival.

There are 4 types of Swallows: the brown, the domestic, the black and the white eyebrow. Mix the cards well and distribute all of them among the players. Whoever has an empty nest will place it on the table.

On each player turn, a card must be played in the ascending progressive order of numbers of each type of swallow, an empty nest must be added to the side, or the player must pass.

The player who has played all their cards wins.


'Golondrina Tramposa'

The game plays the same as Viaje con Alas, but the progressions in the swallow columns can be downloaded without respecting the consecutive order of their values, it will be enough that they are of the same type of swallow.

The winner will be the one who manages to have the least amount of cards in hand once it is impossible to continue with the game because all the columns are "closed".

Each card is worth one point. The first player to reach 30 points exits the game. The winner will be the one with the least points.


Pares de Plumas

Look for a swallow of the same type and collect them on the trip. The bird that travels the most wins.

Five cards are dealt per player, and the remaining cards are turned face down on one side, turning the first one over and placing it on the side.

Each player on their turn can play a swallow of the same type. If you do not have that card, you must lift it from the deck until you find one and lower it.

The player who has played the highest value card between the two of the same type, may bring down another card with the type of swallow that he chooses.

The game ends when one of the players plays all of their cards.

boardgame.name: Azul: Collector's Tile Set 4
boardgame.description:
The Collector's Tile Sets each provide an alternative set of 20 tiles to replace one tile pattern of your choice from the standard Azul box. These sets can be played on the variant side of the player boards.

Collector's Tile Set 4 is 'ultramarine' (deep blue), with a 'pistachio green' (light yellowish green) design.

boardgame.name: Rei dos Memes
boardgame.description:
After his disappointment with the new R$ 200 bill (Brazilian real), our daring Caramel Mutt decided to start a real revolution. He decided to consolidate Brazil once and for all as the King of Memes with a super game and bring fun to everyone on a level never seen before in humanity.

Have lots of laughs with our best Brazilian memes, expressions and slang that everyone loves. Choose the funniest and funniest answers and try to be crowned King or Queen of Memes. WHoever is judged the best, keeps the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

There are 600 sentences with 50,000 (one thousand) different combinations for you to laugh until your belly hurts.

boardgame.name: Yupitergrad
boardgame.description:
Arcade platforming like you haven't seen before. Spatial riddles where you need to be both dexterous and quick-thinking. All bathed in gritty, Slavik, humorous story and wacky acrobatics you simply WON'T find ANYWHERE else.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Deisim
boardgame.description:
In Deisim you can live the experience of being a powerful god.
You can create the world as you want it by performing miracles.
Help humans to evolve by giving them the resources and the ground they need or let them die starving.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Final Assault
boardgame.description:
Final Assault is a WWII themed Action Strategy Game built from the ground up to capitalize on the power of VR. As the player, you Tower over the battlefield as the war rages around you in 360 degrees. Final Assault mixes the combat of an RTS and MOBA, while keeping the focuses on the combat, removing base building and resource gathering and putting you into the battle quickly.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Fields of Glory & Thrilling Encounters Geomorphic Tile
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Expand your Conan Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of roleplaying campaigns with this geomorphic tile set which provides the perfect tabletop furniture for your miniatures. Made with high quality card and featuring a full colour laminated finish, this reversible 16 tile set card set (8 x large and 8 x half size) is marked with movement spaces to match the Conan boardgame by Monolith and features scenes from Fields of Glory & Thrilling Encounters, bringing Conan's grim Hyborian Age to barbarous life, by Crom!
boardgame.rpg: Robert E. Howard's Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of

boardgame.name: Fujii
boardgame.description:
A serene, mystical journey that traverses a series of otherworldly, organic landscapes, Fujii is a respite for weary travelers. The experience flows between outdoor exploration and creative gardening, merging aspects of adventure and cultivation into a refreshing, musically enveloping whole.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dens of Iniquity & Streets of Terror Geomorphic Tiles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Expand your Conan Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of roleplaying campaigns with this geomorphic tile set which provides the perfect tabletop furniture for your miniatures. Made with high quality card and featuring a full colour laminated finish, this reversible 16 tile set card set (8 x large and 8 x half size) is marked with movement spaces to match the Conan boardgame by Monolith and features scenes from Fields of Glory & Thrilling Encounters, bringing Conan's grim Hyborian Age to barbarous life, by Crom!
boardgame.rpg: Robert E. Howard's Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of

boardgame.name: Evil In The North
boardgame.description:
Evil In The North is a solitaire adventure game that is set in a dark wintry realm. The player oversees several game characters as they fulfill missions in this challenging environment. These characters represent a declining pagan population that is caught between the New Religion and the spiteful counter religion known as the Growing Evil. This latter division includes ruffians, malicious necromancers, the infamous NecroFiend occultists, and demons from foul depths.

Player guided characters will travel on a map that consists of card tiles. These tiles require various checks as the characters move from turn to turn. At the same time, game controlled characters known as NecroFiends will be spawned; eventually traveling the tile map through an automated movement system. When player characters run into a NecroFiend, conflict is likely to occur. Opposition can also emerge through the Occurrence deck (from entering a tile) or through the Demon deck (upon exiting a tile). These encounters gnaw away at a character's vital resource --their followers. A lack of followers makes a character extremely vulnerable and will often lead to elimination from the game if more followers cannot be acquired soon.

Combat in the world of Evil in the North is resolved through two means, Brute Conflict and DarkArts Conflict. The former combat type is associated with physical conflict and uses a Combat Results Table involving up to three 4-sided dice. The latter combat type is associated with sorcery and uses a simpler system involving the combatants' INSIGHT ratings and a single 4-sided die.

The game is divided into 3 stages to represent the different missions to be undertaken. To win Evil in the North, a player must fulfill every mission started. The game is lost if all player characters perish during the performance of a mission, regardless of how many missions have been completed. Without losing, you may end a game after any mission (but before another has begun).

ABOUT THE REIMPLEMENTATION:
This game builds on Black Metal by offering a whole new map treatment. Rather than building the tile map as you play, Evil in the North uses a preset tile map that is arranged prior to play. The preset tile map constrains player movement to a 7 x 7 grid (removing the chances of a run-away tile map). Furthermore, additional map tiles have been added to create the vast Ice Sea; a central area of the tile map consisting of 9 map tiles. Additional rules have been created to serve this new aspect of the tile map.

Unlike Black Metal, a regular game of Evil In The North is played with full map disclosure (all map tiles are displayed face-up from the onset).

Other changes/additions include:
--Updated text on many cards (mainly to accommodate the new tile map)
--An updated and consolidated rulebook (integrating the Mission booklet)
--New and updated rulebook diagrams
--New rules and sections within the rulebook (including a new Q&A and Card Clarifications section)
--An official variant sheet for an advanced game

boardgame.name: Crisis VRigade 2
boardgame.description:
Crisis VRigade 2 is a Fast-Paced Virtual Reality Action Shooter that lets players take on the role of a SWAT trooper.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Prison Boss VR
boardgame.description:
Prison Boss VR is a crafting and trading game turning your VR space into a jail cell! Craft cigarettes, alcohol and cookies for other inmates! Customize your cell as your reputation grows! Earn cash until you can’t store it anymore and become the Prison Boss!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Paradiso Geomorphic Tile Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For the last ten years, players have tested their mettle upon the battlefields of the Human Sphere in Corvus Belli's hugely-popular Infinity skirmish game. Now you can expand your adventures, diving deep into the amazing, never-before-seen depths of the Infinity universe with the ultimate science-fiction roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Rags to Dishes
boardgame.description:
Rags to Dishes is a single player, virtual reality (VR) cooking game where you’ll have the chance to travel back in time to the medieval ages and serve some delicious dishes to hungry villagers!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Combined Army Geomorphic Tile Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For the last ten years, players have tested their mettle upon the battlefields of the Human Sphere in Corvus Belli's hugely-popular Infinity skirmish game. Now you can expand your adventures, diving deep into the amazing, never-before-seen depths of the Infinity universe with the ultimate science-fiction roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Cosmodread
boardgame.description:
Trapped in a dying spaceship filled with horrors, you must explore, survive, and find your way back to the safety of Earth. Cosmodread features a rich, tense and immersive atmosphere that will make you forget about the world outside the headset.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Vertigo Remastered
boardgame.description:
It's a classic premise - a massive subterranean scientific facility full of mysteries, with aliens bursting in from alternate universes to wreak havoc. The twist? You're one of those aliens. But you're not here to wreak havoc (collateral damage disregarded), you're just trying to get home. A difficult endeavor, as it turns out this facility is more than prepared to deal with extraterrestrial threats.

Vertigo Remastered is a complete overhaul and occasional reimagining of the 2016 original, bringing modern VR gameplay, new content, and countless fixes/improvements to the table.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Racket NX
boardgame.description:
Racket: Nx is a new kind of game that challenges the limits of what you can do with a racket and ball in VR.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: A Chair in a Room: Greenwater
boardgame.description:
A Chair in a Room: Greenwater is a tense Virtual Reality horror game set in America’s Deep South. Drawing on elements of Southern Gothic and using settings of derelict towns, run-down motels and murky, decaying swamps, A Chair in a Room will take you through an investigation of institutional corruption, religious immorality and murder, which can only be unlocked by searching deep within your own psyche.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: OhShape
boardgame.description:
OhShape is a VR rhythm game offering a unique way of moving your whole body. Dodge obstacles, punch walls and make fun poses to get through each map. Play with the coins and be the star of your own show!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Into the Radius VR
boardgame.description:
Into the Radius is a single-player survival shooter for VR veterans. Stalk the Pechorsk Radius zone filled with surreal landscapes and dangerous anomalies. Use stealth, climbing or realistic firearms to explore, scavenge for loot and recover strange artifacts in an unforgiving dystopian environment.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Warg
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: BattleGroup VR
boardgame.description:
BattleGroupVR is a designed for VR, first person real-time space strategy where you lead a fleet of powerful warships into battle from the bridge of your own flagship. Assemble your fleet, upgrade your load-outs, train your captains, engage the enemy and secure the sector. Try not to go down with the ship.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Material Name
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In many worlds, especially those of the fantasy genre, some materials exist that have properties beyond the normal. A type of wood, for example, might be more resistant to fire, or one particular type of obsidian might glow when underwater due to some arcane property.

There can be many reasons for this, from the place it was made, a result of a spell gone wild or it could even be something once created by a deity for reasons unknown to mortals. Whatever the reason, these variations on the "standard" material have properties that differentiate themselves from the original version.

This Quick Generator gives you a system for creating the names or concepts, of materials suitable for the so-called fantasy genre. Using the 2 x d100 tables provided, you can generate 10,000 possible material names or concepts.

boardgame.name: A Night In The Lonesome Disaster
boardgame.description:
From the description:

THE ELEVATOR PITCH

When you're the non-human Companion to a powerful adept playing the Game, things can go bad in a way most can't imagine. Your Principal needs you to help open a way for the Great Old Ones to return. (Unless they are working against that possibility and require the gate to remain closed.)

Whether your Principal is a Closer or Opener, your short-term goals are the same: gather materials, build your power, learn who the other Principals are, aid the ones who see things the way you do, and stymie the competition. The big event happens (again) on October 31st, midnight, under a full moon.

Guard yourself, protect your Principal, and prepare for the worst. The stars are right...

THE MORE THINGS CHANGE

A Night in the Lonesome Disaster (or ANITLD) is unlike other Fiasco playsets (which are awesome! You should get more. But I digress.) in that the Relationships that you specify during The Setup are the relations between Principals in the Great Game.

In ANITLD, you’ll act as that Principal some of the time, and also as the Principal’s Companion. Companions are animals who the Principals have bonded with; Companions act as familiars, spies, watch-critters, weapon-delivery-systems, and emotional support beasts. Companions have (at least) human intelligence, and some of them may even be able to speak to people. All Companions can communicate with each other.

During The Setup, you will specify Relationships between Principals: teacher and student, wizard and rival, creator and created, whatever. You also get to choose what kind of Companion you will be (there’s a list, but feel free to make up your own). Needs, on the other hand, are those of the Companion, and they may even be at odds with the stated goals of your Principal.

THE MORE THINGS STAY THE SAME

As always, you'll need a copy of the FIASCO rules from Bully Pulpit Games in order to play this playset. You'll need the standard number of dice.

boardgame.name: Horde of the Rat King
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A short dungeon crawl adventure for tabletop rpgs for the MS Paint Jam.

The Horde of the Rat King is a short adventure created in an evening. It's mean to be played with any d20 system, but can easily be adapted to any system.

boardgame.name: Crooked Knight
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A new player class for MÖRK BORG, the Crooked Knight, rides in on his faithful peasant steed! It's one page, and that page is the page in the preview. I thought the Crooked Knight from "D is for Dungeon" had some potential left untapped, so I made a more thorough treatment of the class.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Denizens 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 18 creature characters from myth and old monster books.

boardgame.name: Dark Menagerie 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 characters being set 4 of creatures inspired by a popular "witch/monster" hunting series.

boardgame.name: The Horse Lords
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 22 characters both mounted and on foot inspired by 'The Lord of the Rings' story.

boardgame.name: Undead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 30 creatures of undead, from "classic" versions to strange forms inspired by various video and tabletop games.

boardgame.name: Character Folio 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains a variety of 16 characters taken from requests and commissioned, custom character jobs from fellow gamers.

boardgame.name: Toy Soldiers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 30 tokens of green and tan toy soldiers and vehicles.

boardgame.name: Dark Menagerie 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 characters being set 5 of creatures inspired by a popular "witch/monster" hunting series.

boardgame.name: Forest Guard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 40 fantasy mouse characters of warriors, archers, mages and villagers.

boardgame.name: Ancient Egypt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 22 characters and some vehicles depicting ancient Egyptian court and military units.

boardgame.name: New World Frontiersmen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 22 characters depicting early colonists, scouts, Roger's Rangers and various indian tribes of the new world.

boardgame.name: Gladiators
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 characters depicting gladiators of various historical "classes" of combatants.

boardgame.name: Champions
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 superhero characters inspired by comics, movies and role-playing games.

boardgame.name: Tech Tyrants
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 sci-fi/ cyberworld characters depicting Tech Tyrants and the hired goons and thugs who protect them.

boardgame.name: Ghost Hunters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 18 characters of "ghosts" and ghost hunters inspired by popular movie characters.

boardgame.name: Generica Floorplans Volume 29: Gymnasium • Theater
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

GENERICA Floorplans are a combination of traditional 2D maps and 3D visual aids which can help you flesh out your campaign setting. Generic fantasy town locations (such as Taverns, Temples and Shops) are showcased with carefully designed floorplans and 3D rendered views to provide your players with a more immersive gaming experience.

Each GENERICA Floorplans volume contains one 3D Exterior Mapview, two isometric top-down Floorplan Maps, as well as additional 3D renders of Interior Mapviews. Each download also includes two full-sized gameplay maps designed to be printed at 16” x 20”.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Castle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Castle is 40 x 40 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Farm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Farm is 40 x 30 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Streets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Streets is 36 x 37 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Cave Lake
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Cave Lake is 55 x 40 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: ARK: Survival Evolved Mobile
boardgame.description:
Dive into the ultimate mobile dino-adventure with ARK: Survival Evolved! A massive game world combines with 80+ unique dinosaurs and primal creatures for you to capture and tame - making for a survival experience bar-none. Meet up with other players and friends in this Jurassic-era world, to form tribes and work together to build colonies of survivors.


Artifacts are tributes for getting Blueprints or items at the Obelisks.
Dungeons are the only way to get Tek and fight Bosses.
Taming rate is set to 1.75.
Taming limit currently only 40 animals in singleplayer or 12 for each tribe member (up to 120) on multiplayer. Paying real money for Primal Pass will extend the limit to 60.
Dodo's can be bred for varying sizes on Mobile. You can breed them to be large enough to be ridden or small enough to take them with your shoulder.
The Equus comes with a stat known as Equus Power. Equus Power determines the speed and stamina of the Equus for racing.


Unique Features:


Ancient Amber is a premium currency that can be used to purchase instant-crafting structures, character buffs, other special consumables and to resurrect dead creatures (tamed or wild).
Primal Pass is a subscription available for $4.99 USD a month or $39.99 USD a year. It provides a permanent double XP buff, 20 additional tame slots, a monthly loot promo code, the removal of all ads (including those on Free Gifts)
New Creature Variant: Eerie

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress Resin Special Enemy 'The Big One' Feudal Bandit
boardgame.description:
Featured in the Forbidden Fortress Feudal Village Expansion. That set contains all of the rules for 'The Big One' Feudal Bandit, but usually players just use a token to represent that a standard Feudal Bandit is 'The Big One'. Now, you can have a specific miniature for 'The Big One' Feudal Bandit in your games of Forbidden Fortress!
—description from the publisher

This is a resin miniature to replace the cardboard token that comes with Shadows of Brimstone: Feudal Village Expansion. It adds no new gameplay elements and is purely cosmetic.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: Feudal Village Expansion

boardgame.name: Fantasy Realms: Fénix
Fantasy Realms: Phoenix
boardgame.description:
Fantasy Realms: Phoenix is the winning card of the Spanish contest "Create your Fantasy Realms card" organized by Looping Games in December 2020. WizKids and the author of the game, Bruce Glassco, chose it among several finalists. It's the first card multiclass of the game:

- Beast
- Strength: 14
- Bonus: Also counts as a Flame and Weather card.
- Penalty: BLANKED with any Flood card. If this card is BLANKED for any reason, its base strength is reduced to 0 but it retains its suits.

This card was given away at GenCon 2021 and is included in all Spanish copies of Fantasy Realms The Cursed Hoard.

boardgame.name: La Cripta de Plagcrow
boardgame.description:
A Story based on the fourteenth century in the midst of the Black Death that attacked Poor Europe, with touches of Fantasy from the Creator Himself.

When you are on your turn you roll the dice to advance through the board. You have the option of being able to play up to 2 cards but at the same time you can only draw one from the deck. The turns do not have a time limit so you have all the time to think about playing any card or simply advance and end your turn.

The game ends when someone reaches the end of the board or you are the last player alive, since each player has a certain amount of life that varies depending on the character you choose at the beginning, if they kill you you lose.


Una Historia basada en el Siglo XIV en medio de la Peste Negra que atacaba la Pobre Europa , con toques de Fantasía del Propio Creador. Este incluye:Un juego de Mesa que mezcla un Tablero, Cartas , Dados con funciones diferentes, Selección de Personajes , Vida y muchísimo mas incluyendo un sistema basado en el puro Azar y el Riesgo por la Recompensa lo que hace que la "Cripta de Plagcrow" sea un Juego en donde el Jugador deberá pensar su siguiente movimiento y adaptarse a los Cambios Rotundos que puede dar el mismo juego independientemente de los demás jugadores. Tienes la Libertad de elegir entre una forma de jugar mas segura y defensiva, así como todo lo contrario y ser un Rival que solo busca desatar el Caos! aunque le pueda costar la Victoria. Con 7 tipos de Cartas además de ser más de 500 diferentes entre si y extrañas formas de jugar lo hace un juego ideal si estas agobiado de los juegos convencionales en donde el factor sorpresa se apaga al jugar unas cuantas partidas ya sea con las mismas personas o cambiando de jugadores , La Cripta brinda que nunca 2 partidas se parezcan entre si así como esa seguridad de saber que nada asegura la Victoria ni la Derrota, Sera tu decisión de aguantar hasta el final o rendirte ante la situación.

boardgame.name: My Hero card game: Izuku Midoriya and his classmates of Class 1-A.
boardgame.description:
My Hero Card Game MH-01 features primary protagonist Izuku Midoriya and his classmates of Class 1-A. Will you be able to learn all the quirks of the heroes and mirror Izuku’s notebook collection?

Play a character card from the show to attack other characters and your opponents. Attack your opponent when their guardian stack is empty to win.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: My Hero card game: All Might and All For One set
My Hero card game: All Might and All For One set

boardgame.name: Creature Feature
boardgame.description:
In this game of hand management and bluffing by Richard Garfield, you are a movie agent representing actors who excel at particularly monstrous roles. Try to get them the part in the feature film! Or, failing that, at least a part in SOME film.

Each round you will assign a Co-star and a Star (cards with a number value and possibly a special ability) to audition for a role (a tile worth points). Everyone will reveal their co-stars and then have the opportunity to change what they are auditioning for and instead try for lesser films worth fewer points. Winning a part scores points - but there's a twist! If your star has a lower value than your co-star, you can't win unless everyone else stops competing for that film... but if everyone DOES back off, you score extra points!

The game ends after a fixed number of rounds, and the player with the most points wins!

boardgame.description:
My Hero Card Game MH-03 features All Might, the world’s greatest hero and All For One, the leader of the infamous League of Villains. Will you choose to be a hero or to embrace your villain side?

Play a character card from the show to attack other characters and your opponents. Attack your opponent when their guardian stack is empty to win.

boardgame.name: Broncho Billie
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever wanted to be a cowboy in the Old West? This book has you slapping leather.

This book is designed as a solo game experience using the art from the public domain comics of Broncho Bill (Broncho Billlie is on the cover!) It is a linear adventure, in the style of choosing your own adventures. It's close to being a roll and write RPG, with more direction, due to it being a training book. This book is the first in the series of basic gamebooks that explain how to play. This covers basic dice rolling, so don't expect anything very complex.

After the series of example books are complete, the advanced core rules for Public Domain Game will be published. With the core rules you will be able to take any comic book and run your character through it. With the advanced rules, you will be able to find the target numbers on each page by simply reading the page and using charts from the rules. Your character will advance, whether they win or fail!

To sum up, you can take your original character into the main role of any comic book, even the modern ones, with the upcoming advanced rules. This particular guide is the basics of how to get started.

boardgame.name: Skelly Tales
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You scared? This is a pre-code horror comic strip, tame by modern standards I'm sure, but proper for Halloween.

This book is designed as a solo game experience using the art from the public domain comics of Weird Terror #1 (1952). It is a linear adventure, in the style of choosing your own adventures. It's close to being a roll and write RPG, with more direction, due to it being a training book. This book is the second in the series of basic guidebooks that explain how to play. This covers basic dice rolling with Wild Dice, what some games call rolling with Advantage.

After the series of example books are complete, the advanced core rules for Public Domain Game will be published. With the core rules you will be able to take any comic book and run your character through it. With the advanced rules, you will be able to find the target numbers on each page by simply reading the page and using charts from the rules. Your character will advance, whether they win or fail!

To sum up, you can take your original character into the main role of any comic book, even the modern ones, with the upcoming advanced rules. This particular guide is the basics of how to get started.

boardgame.name: Skelly Tales 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You scared? This is a pre-code horror comic strip, tame by modern standards I'm sure, but proper for Halloween.

This book is designed as a solo game experience using the art from the public domain comics of Strange Mysteries #3 (1952). It is a linear adventure, in the style of choosing your own adventures. It's close to being a roll and write RPG, with more direction, due to it being a training book. This book is the third in the series of basic guidebooks that explain how to play. This covers basic dice rolling with Wild Dice, and sets up the Stats.

After the series of example books are complete, the advanced core rules for Public Domain Game will be published. With the core rules you will be able to take any comic book and run your character through it. With the advanced rules, you will be able to find the target numbers on each page by simply reading the page and using charts from the rules. Your character will advance, whether they win or fail!

To sum up, you can take your original character into the main role of any comic book, even the modern ones, with the upcoming advanced rules. This particular guide is the basics of how to get started.

boardgame.name: Skelly Tales 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This book has a summary of all the rules from the first 3, and it is a sidequest for characters from those, or it can be a jumping on point for the next one.

It is designed as a solo game experience using the art from the public domain comics of Weird Planets #13 (1957). It is a linear adventure, in the style of choosing your own adventures. It's close to being a roll and write RPG, with more direction, due to it being a training book. This book is the fourth in the series of basic guidebooks that explain how to play. This one goes over basic dice rolling with Wild Dice, and sets up the Stats.

After the series of example books are complete, the advanced core rules for Public Domain Game will be published. With the core rules you will be able to take any comic book and run your character through it. With the advanced rules, you will be able to find the target numbers on each page by simply reading the page and using charts from the rules. Your character will advance, whether they win or fail!

To sum up, you can take your original character into the main role of any comic book, even the modern ones, with the upcoming advanced rules. This particular guide is the basics of how to get started.

boardgame.name: Skelly Tales 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The final book in the series. These five books contain all the rules for playing the game.

It is designed as a solo game experience using the art from the public domain comics of Jungle Comics #15 (1941). It is a linear adventure, in the style of choosing your own adventures. It's close to being a roll and write RPG, with more direction, due to it being a training book. This book is the fifth in the series of basic guidebooks that explain how to play. This one shows how to gain and use Powers, of the Cosmic variety.

After the series of example books are complete, the advanced core rules for Public Domain Game will be published. With the core rules you will be able to take any comic book and run your character through it. With the advanced rules, you will be able to find the target numbers on each page by simply reading the page and using charts from the rules. Your character will advance, whether they win or fail!

boardgame.name: Lady Clock
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This book is designed as a solo game experience using an adventure of the Clock, using your own original character, a character you played in one of the other gamebooks, or even as Lady Clock herself!

It is a linear adventure, in the style of choosing your own adventures.

There will be more books like this from the Golden Age of comics, including space, detectives, and of course superheroes! The system is set up so that you can take the character you use here in the other books, in any order. Your pugelist can become a superhero!

This particular charactere, Lady Clock, will be the lore behind your character, if you want. Think of her as a Doctor, with time magic to take your character from Crom, the age of heroes, to the far future of SpaceHawk, and anywhere in between.

boardgame.name: Crom the Barbarian Gamebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever wanted to be a barbarian in the times of legend? With this first book, you can! Either make your own character using the simple game system included, or play as Crom himself.

This book is designed as a solo game experience using the restored art of Gardner Fox from the original Crom book, first published in 1950 in Out of this World #1. It is a linear adventure, in the style of choosing your own adventures.

If this does well, there will be more books like this from the Golden Age of comics, including space, detectives, and of course superheroes! The system is set up so that you can take the character you use here in the other books, in any order. Your barbarian can become a war hero!

boardgame.name: Cromic Book
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the [abbreviated version of] Crom the Barbarian Gamebook. At the end of the book is a simple preview of the game system, enough to make characters and see how they would work.

The entire strip is included in the preview, if you just want the story.

Consider supporting this title to get more restorations of the golden age of comics!

boardgame.name: Transformers Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

In the Transformers Roleplaying Game, create your own Autobot character and wage your battle to destroy the evil forces of the Decepticons! Whether defending Earth against Megatron’s plans of attack, searching for elusive stores of Energon, or protecting innocent humans and Cybertronians alike, your game is only limited by the stories you create!

This book contains everything you need to create your own Transformers robot character and play the game - just add dice, some friends, and your imagination.

boardgame.name: G.I. JOE Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the G.I. JOE Roleplaying game, create your own Joe by choosing your military training origin, personal traits, and role within the G.I. JOE organization to become a Real American Hero and save the day!

This book contains everything you need to create your own G.I. JOE character and play the game - just add dice, some friends, and your imagination.

boardgame.name: Second Inquisition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The secret Church and the hidden State, hunting the hunters in cities and across continents.

An antagonists’ guide to the rising Second Inquisition, this book contains:


Opponents of your Kindred, and their special forces and equipment
Information on the fires rising against the world’s vampires, stoked by the Society of St. Leopold and the American FIRSTLIGHT black program
New tools to expand your chronicles, including eldritch Artifacts, dozens of dangerous antagonists, and the tactics your coterie can use to fight back

boardgame.name: Sabbat: La Mano Nera
Sabbat: The Black Hand
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Brothers and Sisters in Caine, united under the banner of the Dark Father

An antagonists’ guide to the cultic fanatics of the Sabbat, this book contains:


Descriptions of the Paths of Enlightenment, the foundations of Sabbat identity
Information on the Gehenna War, and how the Sabbat opposes the dread Antediluvians
New tools to expand your chronicles, including Discipline powers, versatile antagonists, and the horrifying Ritae of the Black Hand


Sabbat: The Black Hand is a supplement for the Vampire: The Masquerade Roleplaying Game, outlining in detail the lore and background of the Sabbat, including new Paths and Disciplines, histories, and new Storyteller resources for a richer roleplaying experience.

boardgame.name: Storyteller's Screen & Toolkit
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The official Vampire: Masquerade 5th Edition Storyteller Screen is a high quality multi panel portrait format and features plenty of content to help power your chronicle. The exterior features beautiful rendered artwork from Vampire: The Masquerade, while the inside cover contains useful rules references, tables and charts for Storytellers!

Features:


Beautiful artwork that wraps around the outer facing 4 panels of the screen.
Contains reference tables and key rules
Includes a 32-page Storyteller booklet containing tools and advice on creating and running a Vampire: The Masquerade chronicles.


At a Glance


4 panel Storyteller’s Screen for Vampire: The Masquerade
5”x11” folded screen and booklet
32 page Source Book for Vampire: The Masquerade

boardgame.name: Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood of Venice – Deluxe Assassin Dice Set
boardgame.description:
20 Deluxe marble-like dice in a tuck box.

4 x 4 assassin's dice (matching assassin's colors)
4 additional detection dice

boardgame.name: The Book of Nod
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The first vampires remember their first nights, but do not speak of them. Others have heard tales, but know better than to believe them. The wise speak of The Book of Nod, but none have seen this fabled book of ancient lore.

These are their tales...

Their stories begin with the Chronicle of Caine and the earliest nights of the vampire. The Chronicle of Shadow reveals Caine's hidden teachings. Finally, the Chronicle of Secrets unveils the deepest mysteries of the Damned, including the coming dread of Gehenna.

The Book of Nod is a collection of mythic texts for use in the Vampire the Masquerade Roleplaying Game.
Presented as an epic poem, the Book of Nod is an in-game resource, viewed as sacred by Noddist scholars and most vampire elders, especially of the Sabbat. Rather than a book of game mechanics, this book can be used as a prop and for lore, as it outlines the genesis of vampires with the mythology of Caine.

boardgame.description:

This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.

boardgame.name: Power Rangers Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Become a Power Ranger and protect Angel Grove and the Earth against the evil forces of Rita Repulsa, Lord Zedd, Master Vile, and more in the epic world of Power Rangers! Whether you interrupt Rita’s monster attacks in her attempt of world domination or defeat the forces of the Machine Empire from invading Earth, there is no limit to the heroic stories you will tell.

In the Power Rangers Roleplaying Game, create your ultimate Power Ranger persona by combining personal traits, childhood influences, and your chosen Ranger color to make a hero worthy of the Power!

This book contains everything you need to create your own Power Rangers character and play the game - just add dice, some friends, and your imagination.

boardgame.name: Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters – Kira's Story
boardgame.description:
Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters is a story about two time travelers - Kira and Isabel - partners who have explored the farthest reaches of time, from ancient dynasties to the birth of the dinosaurs, and even the distant future. But disaster struck on their latest adventure, splitting their time machine in two and marooning them each in a different place and time!

In Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Kira's Story, you take the role of Kira as she works to repair her half of the time machine and hopefully reconnect with Isabel before she is lost forever.

Just like all of the Escape Room in a Box games, the puzzles in Kira's Story are non-linear, meaning there is always something for everyone to do - just like a real life escape room.

Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Kira's Story can be combined with Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Isabel's Story to unlock a special bonus game, designed to be played remotely via video chat, that allows you to experience the final chapter in their story. Players from both groups will have to work together, share notes, collaborate on puzzles, and hopefully to reunite the two wayward time travelers.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters – Isabel's Story

boardgame.description:
Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters is a story about two time travelers - Isabel and Kira - partners who have explored the farthest reaches of time, from ancient dynasties to the birth of the dinosaurs, and even the distant future. In Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Isabel's Story, you take the role of Isabel as she works to repair her half of the time machine and hopefully reconnect with Kira before she is lost forever.

Just like all of the Escape Room in a Box games, the puzzles in Isabel's Story are non-linear, meaning there is always something for everyone to do - just like a real life escape room.

Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Isabel's Story can be combined with Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Kira's Story to unlock a special bonus game, designed to be played remotely via video chat, that allows you to experience the final chapter in their story.
