boardgame.name: Nouvelles ContRées
boardgame.description:
What if you could explore books, browse the texts of novels, cross literary landscapes and their imaginations, surprise yourself with a few incredible sentences.

Nouvelles ContRées is a cooperative game that invites you on this dreamlike journey. You become novel explorers, navigating your best through the jungle of words, until you find, at the heart of the novel, the incredible hidden meaning of the book.

At the start of the game, players set up their Camp, represented by a bookmark, somewhere in the book. During the game, they will advance the Camp to a Lost City bookmark located further away.

One player plays as the pathfinder ("Pagefinder"): they read the first six lines of one page of any book in your library (as long as it has at least 60 pages). The other players have to guess which fully-illustrated bookmarks among 4 Dixit like bookmarks face up is the one chosen by the pathfinder. If the other players find the good bookmark, all the players succeed: they travel through the jungle of words by the same path (they advance pages in the book.).

At the same time, each player can try to accomplish an individual mission like "I guess the text contains 5 words with a X", "I guess it contains 3 words related to the nature", ...

To win, players will need to successfully explore this city and gain access to the Hidden Meaning of the book.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Initié Nominee

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: My Father's Hammer
boardgame.description:
From the description:

My Father's Hammer is a solo or group story-telling game where you role-play as a Tool inherited from a beloved Ancestor. Over time you age and your Components require Replacement, but somehow you are always the same.

This is My Father’s Hammer.

Once my father used it. Now it is passed down to me.

I use it to build, fix, improvise.

The grip wears out and a new one is wrapped around its handle.

And still this is My Father's Hamer.

The wood grows old and the handle cracks. A new handle is fitted.

And still this is My Father's Hamer.

The head rusts and flakes. A new head is attached to the handle.

And still this is My Father's Hamer.

boardgame.name: The [Abandoned] Goblin Tower
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The abandoned tower has been taken over by goblins! Can you ascend the old ruins, defeat the intruders, and find any magical treasure left behind?

But adventurer beware... Something sinister lurks in the rafters above!

boardgame.name: Wiñay Kawsay
boardgame.description:
The site of Machu Picchu has captured the imagination of historians for over a century. However, despite years of seeking to understand its secrets, the functionality of Machu Picchu is still an enigma. Was it a lost city as stipulated by legendary explorer Hiram Bingham III? Or was it a royal estate? Perhaps a citadel? A religious site? Or maybe something else entirely?
It is up to you, my fellow historians, to explore the evidence found at Machu Picchu to argue for an interpretation of the functionality of the site. However, given the cutthroat nature of publish-or-perish academia, will you be able to succeed in dominating the academic and public perception of what Machu Picchu really was?

Wiñay Kawsay is a 2-4 player competitive board game, of approximately 90-120 minutes* duration, in which players are historians seeking to manipulate the academic and public perception of the functionality of Machu Picchu. Though largely a deck building game, Wiñay Kawsay also involves worker placement (these workers being assistants and a Lead Researcher), management and changing colour of blocks, and the deconstruction and rebuilding of a central block model of Machu Picchu that represents the academic and public perception of the functionality of the site.

The name Wiñay Kawsay means “history” in Kichwa, the language family of the Inca. However the word more literally translates to “always life”, reflecting the ever evolving and living nature of history and historical narratives.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ich fahr' voll ab auf Österreich
boardgame.description:
Travel bloggers stage a challenge throughout Austria: Each player gains goal cards which depict beautiful places and nice vacation spots in Austria.

Who is the first to fulfill their goal cards and get the blogger pairs to their favourite destinations? Not easy, since the bloggers are traveling undercover. It's important to remember the last location of the blogger and be faster than the other players.

—decription from the back of the box (translated)

boardgame.name: Go! Doggy Go!
boardgame.description: Go, Doggy, Go is a simple race game where your dog can get longer and shorter as the game progresses. A dog wins the race when their hind legs reach the goal; so you need more steps if your dog is longer.

boardgame.name: Mekaröth
boardgame.description:
Here you are in the middle of a Steampunk universe, playing the role of ambitious little rabbits ready to do anything to recover the magic crystals scattered throughout an enchanted forest that will defend itself. The aim of the game: the first rabbit to have returned to its burrow with enough Carrot Crystals wins the game.

60 tiles are laid on their "Nature" side. Some tiles will trigger effect when reached. All tiles are flipped to their "industrial" side after the rabbit has completed its movements. Flipping tiles will trigger different effects.
Effects can be: revealing a mine (with a Carrot Crystal), radar (allowing to flip 2 tiles anywhere on the board), Treant (losing 1 Carrot Crystal and flipping back surrounding tiles to their nature side). Some Relic Crystals will provide special powers such as free movement, immunity against Wolves, etc.

—user summary

Vous voici projetés en plein univers Steampunk, incarnant d’ambitieux petits lapins prêts à tout pour récupérer les cristaux magiques éparpillés à travers une forêt enchantée qui saura se défendre…
But du jeu : le premier lapin à avoir regagné son terrier avec suffisamment de Cristaux-Carottes remporte la partie.

—description from the publisher (French)

boardgame.name: Character Options
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Deadly Gardens: Character Options! The Deadly Gardens series has always contained bits and pieces of player usable content including feats, spells, alchemical and magic items, and of course natural items! We have also even published two new races, the forest shadows and the verids, in the Deadly Gardens line. However, this is the largest offering of player-focused content in the Deadly Gardens line to date! Included is a brand new class - the steward is a hybrid of druid a monk. Also included are nature-themed options for a dozen other classes from bard to wizard. Plus new plant companions and plant familiars! On top of that, we have nature-themed feats, spells, and occult rituals. Finally, we introduce an entirely new type of consumable magic item - the spell fruit. This one has been in the works for a while, so I am very happy to have it out to you now!

boardgame.name: Identity Crisis: The Party Game!
boardgame.description:
In Identity Crisis, you're playing the ultimate game of 'guess who?' This is a feel good party game to have you and your friends racking your brains trying to figure out what is on the active players' (The Judge) mind and the results are sure to cause some laughs.

Game play involves The Judge drawing three cards and laying them out and all of the other players trying to describe a person that the descriptors on those cards match. Answers are shouted enthusiastically and the player with the closest fit wins the round and becomes the new Judge. But there is a twist on the standard 'judgement' mechanic. If people are too slow to yell out their suggestions, a card is turned facedown and no longer counts as a scored card!

The aim of the game is to have 15 cards in order to win.

boardgame.name: The Hunt for Treasure Cove
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hunt for treasure cove is a 5 encounter Pirating and pillaging adventure, for all who roam the sea at heart. Get ready to search for clues, avoid traps, and fight your way to the heart of pirating itself, treasure. t is designed for a 5 person party at beginning levels (1-4), so can be a good way to start a campaign. This one shot includes some world building, but not a full map, allowing DM's to create their own or fit the game to a previous map.

boardgame.name: The Frozen Temple of Glacier Peak
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The melting ice has revealed the walls of a long-forgotten temple at the summit of Glacier Peak. Historians and adventurers travel from afar to witness this legend come back to life, hoping to get a slice of the untold riches surely contained within. There is just one problem: The entrance is yet to be found.

The Frozen Temple of Glacier Peak is a dungeon adventure for Knave and other OSR/old-school games inspired by Nordic folklore. It is suitable for a party of level 1-3 adventurers. It is 24 pages long and densely packed with content.

boardgame.name: The Battle for Thor's Cliff
boardgame.description:
In 993 AD, the Daughter of Thor is born on an island called Thor's Cliff.

Seven years later - in the year 1000 - four Heroes, Raghild, Bera, Jorund, and Oleif, battle for the favor of the mighty Child who could change the fait of the entire world while ancient forces reawaken ...

In this non-cooperative game, players try to earn the love of Thor's Daughter by gifting her amber and gemstones. Each player follows their own strategy according to their Hero’s individual abilities. By earning silver, fighting trolls, recruiting new warriors, and buying various items for their Heroes, players battle each other in this strategic adventure game.

The game includes a 3-part introduction narrating the epic backstory which lets players learn the rules step by step with every chapter.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Blitzkrieg!: World War Two in 20 Minutes
boardgame.description:
New Square Edition: Now includes Nippon expansion, updated Axis bag art, and an updated rulebook!

Recreate World War Two in 20 minutes! The perfect wargame for non-wargamers, Blitzkrieg! allows two players to battle across the War’s most iconic theatres, winning key campaigns and building military might.

Players draw army tokens from a bag to determine their starting forces and to replenish their losses. Rather than ‘fighting’ battles with dice or cards, players allocate their military resources to each theatre’s campaigns, winning victory points, further resources, special weapons, and strategic advantages as they play. Refight World War Two several times in one evening!

Includes Solo mode by Dávid Turczi.

Rules changes include:
- Score bonus VPs from war track once when closing theatre due to reaching end of war track
- Can only move token to end of war track in theatre where token placed, not on other tokens (i.e. Strategic Advantage or Nuclear Weapon)
- When closing a theatre by reaching the end of a battle track, you receive the bonus VPs on the battle track once.
- Only the theatre you placed a token in can be closed by reaching the end of the battle track. If the effect of a battle space (Strategic Advantage) or token (Nuclear Weapon) would cause the marker of a different theatre to reach the end of the battle track, it instead stops at the penultimate space.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Blitzkrieg!: World War Two in 20 Minutes

boardgame.name: DKT Smart
boardgame.description: This version of an old classic makes use of an app that offers different game modi and minigames to give you a chance to break out of jail or win more money.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 6 Spieldauer: 60 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8+
DKT - Das kaufmännische Talent - Kaufen - Investieren - Handeln Hier in der neuen Version mit App für zusätzlichen Spielspaß. Erlebe den österreichischen Spieleklassiker für die ganze Familie in Kombination mit einer interaktiven Spiele-App. Sichere dir die wertvollsten Grundstücke, baue dein Immobilien-Imperium auf und erwirtschafte ein Vermögen durch das Kassieren von saftigen Mieten. Doch Vorsicht vor den Mitspielern, die einem den finanziellen Ruin wünschen. Die jüngste DKT-Variante bringt viel Neues mit sich. So findet sich erstmal ganz Österreich am Spielplan. Während des Spiels kommt es laufend zu spannenden Auktionen oder zu spontanen, von der App ausgelösten Mini-Spielen. Wie im echten Leben verändern sich die Preise ständig, sie passen sich Angebot und Nachfrage an. Die Spieler können ins Casino gehen oder zu einem Makler. Wer Glück hat, erhält für einen kurzen Moment VIP-Status und erhält so finanzielle Vorteile.
Generationen beliebte Spielprinzip von DKT ist auch in dieser Variante erhalten geblieben. Die Erfolgsformel lautet daher unverändert „Kaufen, bauen und kassieren“. Das gezielte Kaufen von Grundstücken, die klassische Wertsteigerung durch Häuser- und Hotelbauten und natürlich das satte Abkassieren von den Mitspielern führen am Ende zum größten Reichtum.
Durch den optimierten Spielablauf ist „DKT Smart“ auch bestens für nur zwei Spieler geeignet, und nach 60-90 Minuten zeigt sich bereits, wer das größte kaufmännische Talent besitzt.
https://youtu.be/6lRy3bqTrKw
Spielinhalt: 1 Spielplan 6 Spielfiguren 2 Würfel 8 Hotels 32 Häuser 27 Grundstückskarten 40 Chancekarten 18 Vorkaufsrechtkarten 24 Schuldscheinkarten 1 Startgeldkarte 1 VIP-Marker 2 Mietpreismarker 280 Geldscheine
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: The Adventure of the Great Hunt
boardgame.description:
From the back of the PDF:

The Adventure of the Great Hunt is a special preview of Pendragon 6th Edition, released on the
occasion of WeAreAllUs 2020! WeAreAllUs, observed on the anniversary of Greg Stafford’s
passing, is Chaosium’s commemoration of its founder and original creative visionary.

Inside, you will find everything you need to play: a six-page Quick Start version of the rules,
pregenerated characters, and a scenario that sees the knights set off on a month-long hunt,
racing against time to save the life of a great and noble knight and defeat an infernal dragon
ravaging the countryside. Only they will find salvation lies not in steel and brawn, but in the
gentle belch of a panther...

Pendragon is Chaosium’s innovative roleplaying game of adventure, romance, and intrigue set
in the marvelous world of King Arthur and the champions of the Round Table. Players take
on the roles of heroic knights: men and women who harness their passions and beliefs in their
quest for honor and glory. Along with their companions—brave squires, seekers of knowledge,
and courtly folk of good heart—they are all that stand between Arthur’s vision of a just and
humane future and the dire forces that would see it fail.

boardgame.name: Dinosaur World: Add On Pack
boardgame.description: Includes Solo mode cards, 68 Dinosaur meeples with heat-transfer artwork, and 6 Special Building tiles unlocked during the Dinosaur World Kickstarter campaign.

boardgame.name: The Character Archaic
boardgame.description:
"The Character Archaic" contains early character sheets for use with the original "Dungeons & Dragons" as well as a map and some gaming aids.
The twenty-seven character sheets come in three colors - green, light yellow, and deep yellow - with small character drawings in the upper left corner.

The last four pages are:
1. The Wizard's Tomb (a map)
2. Combat Matrix Reference (fill in your system)
3. Character Roll Call for Quick Reference.
4. Creative Encounters.

From the inside front cover:

The Character Archaic.

Produced by Pete & Judy Kerestan
Printing & Layout by Jerry Wellfonder
Art Work by Brad Schenk
1st Printing 1975

Copyright 1975

From the inside back cover:

Distributed exclusively by TSR Hobbies, Inc.

boardgame.name: Last Minute Christmas
boardgame.description:
Christmas is coming and we still haven't put the tree together!

In Last Minute Christmas we will have to decorate our Christmas tree using ornaments within everyone's reach, but as we are taking out of the same box they will be running out, so we must choose carefully so as not to stay with the tree half decorated.

It is a roll and write game for 2 to 5 players where each one will choose and draw ornaments trying to reach the end with the most festive tree. For this they must choose carefully which ornament they place each turn and in which position of the tree they place it.

The active turn player will throw 3 dice, and select the result of one die for drawing their ornament. The passive players will cross out the selected ornament, and choose one of the remaining corresponding to one of the other two dice.

At the end of the 15th or 16th turn (depending on the number of players), you will add up the scores. Whoever gets the highest result will be the winner and will have managed to decorate the most festive tree!

boardgame.name: Turning Tides
boardgame.description:
Turning Tides is a naval battle between two players. Each player takes control of a ship that they will have to manage. During rounds the ships will sail past each other zone for zone in a modular style. During each step of sailing, players will be able to draw and play an action card which will either help them place new sailors and cannons on their ship, utilize movement of units or the ships themselves, or attack the enemy ship. Play happens simultaniously throughout the game, which means the game has litte idle time. In between rounds players have the option of swapping cards from- and into their playing deck, which changes the capabilities of each player for the next round.

You win a game by either destroying three zones on the enemy ship to sink them, or get rid of the entire enemy crew as to set them adrift into the rocks.

You will have to position your crewmen and cannons tactically to do as much damage to the enemy boat as possible, all the while trying to avoid your opponent from doing the same to you. Aside from that, you have your captain to think about. Losing them is a costly mistake and will give opponent the upperhand. A game focused on patience, tactics and outwitting your opponent.

boardgame.name: Villa María: Ciudad del Aprendizaje
boardgame.description:
In this game developed in conjunction with the Municipality of Villa María, the player must tour the city, passing through various educational and cultural institutions, and various points of interest, in order to get learning points, which will crown him as the winner of the game.

It can be played from 2 to 4 participants representing a group of visitors. It consists of a three-day tour of different places that the city offers to know and learn. At the end of the journey, whoever makes the most enriching trip wins, but the idea is that “everyone has learned interesting things”.

"Learning Points" can be earned in various ways during the game. The die indicates the number of movement points on the board and the number of squares that must advance on the timer. Thus, it moves around the board that represents the map of the city.

This game has the particularity of being accompanied by an application for mobile devices with which the cards of the game are scanned to obtain more information about the places that are visited.

boardgame.name: Talvisota 1939-1940: La Guerre Russo-Finlandaise
boardgame.description:
Based on a system favoring the fog of war and the uncertainties of military preparations, "Talvisota 1939-1940: The Soviet-Finnish Winter War" places both players in a situation requiring them to choose their strategies after careful reflection. Maintaining one’s war morale is important, but the decisive results are mainly achieved by considering the potential actions of the other side. In the solitaire mode, the player controls the Soviet forces against a Finnish A.I. opponent. System by Lionel Liron.

Published in VaeVictis #158

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---

In 1939, faced with Nazi Germany’s expansionist politics, Stalin demands of Finland some strategic territories necessary for the defense of Leningrad. Helsinki refuses and on 30 November, with no prior Declaration of War, the Red Army attacks the Finnish territory with five armies and 28 divisions.

The strength ratio is crushingly in the Soviets’ favor with 400,000 combatants, 1500 tanks and a modern aviation against 265,000 Finnish soldiers and 20 tanks. To everyone’s surprise, the overwhelming numerical and material superiority of the Russians is broken by the fierce resistance and the bravery of the Finnish forces.

Despite a front extending from the Arctic to the isthmus of Karelia, and the offensives of mostly 3 against 1, the lack of preparation and coordination of Stalin’s forces, the extreme climatic conditions and the Finnish belligerence jostle all predictions and overturn military logic. Mannerheim’s troops employ Molotov cocktails, surprise infiltrations and an optimal exploitation of the terrain to resist the Russian giant until March. But the lack of armament and international support, the limited numbers of troops, and a Soviet surge irreversibly compel the little Nordic outlier to sign an accord on 12 March 1940.

boardgame.name: Mapping the World
boardgame.description:
As explorers bring back more and more detailed knowledge about other parts of the world from their travels, cartographers use that knowledge to create intricate maps of the world. As the new trade gains influence in science and at royal courts, new methods and tools are invented - modern cartography is born!

In Mapping the World, you are a cartographer striving to become the best-known master of your trade by creating a map of the world. You'll send out explorers to discover new territories, develop new tools, and manage your riches and influence at the royal court. Will you become the most prolific cartographer and win the game, or will one of your colleagues take the prize?

On your turn, either pick up cards from a common market (which will also change the rest of that market for the following players), or play cards from your hand to perform various actions, like moving your explorer's ship, or upgrading your equipment. The central action consists of Mapping different parts of the globe, which will net you victory points as well as fulfill different objectives that will change from one game to another. After a player has fulfilled a certain number of objectives, the game ends and the player with the most victory points wins.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Zealous Zouaves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Give your adventurers a common identity as members of the same mercenary band or belong to a knight’s household.

Join one of 17 knight orders or 9 mercenary companies in troupe-style play or design your own.
Rules for level zero characters
39 new traits
The Pixie class


Featuring the sellswords of the Atlis Coast Guard, the Cancelors, the Iron Thunderers, Bahadur’s Buccaneers, the Living Wall, Synnova’s Simian Separatives, the Two Moons, the Death Dealers, the White Eagles, the illustrious orders of the Knights of Alliteration, the Knights of Mistrust, the Knights of Kingliness, the Knights of the Orb, the Knights of the Order of Ataxia, the Knights of Purity, the Knights of the Purple Bolide, the Knights of the Robin, the Knights of the Regal Flamingo, the Knights of the Rose Blossom, the Knights of Tezany, the Knights of the Weeping Skull, the Knights of the Wolflord, the Servant Knights of the Portal, the Sphilis School of Strumpetry, the Supreme Knights of the Dragon and the Tenacious Knights of the Slug, with their background and heraldry.

boardgame.name: Fiends of the Deep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book presents new monsters for use in your Odysseys & Overlords game. Although you will need to read through and occasionally reference the materials in the Odysseys & Overlords Game Master’s Guide and Nations of the Orclands to understand the material presented within, this book contains complete stat blocks for ten creatures for use with Odysseys & Overlords!

The creatures included in this book populate the oceans that surround the core continent presented in Odysseys & Overlords. These creatures are inspired by the events of the Roll for Seduction Odysseys & Overlords campaign, which you can watch on twitch if you are over 18.

boardgame.name: The Aerarium Contingency
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While hacking into an Insurrection Virus-controlled node, the team discovers repeated references to a secret project. Following up on the project unveils the virus’ deadly contingency plan and pits the scrappers against a pair of unusual murder-drones.

boardgame.name: GEG Geländespiel
boardgame.description:
The players start with 3 pawns at the four big circles and have to reach the opposite one, which is also the starting space of another player. Movement is one space forward or sideways per turn, never backwards, on the branched path. Since the pawns may not jump over each other, they are able to block each other. If a player isn't able to move, he is out of the game.

The first player to get all 3 pawns to the destination circle wins the game.

This game was published between 1933 and 1945.

boardgame.name: Dag en Nacht
boardgame.description:
"Dag en Nacht" is Dutch for "Day and Night."

The board is an nxn squared board, where n is an odd number between 11 and 19. A 15x15 board is considered average. The board is laid out in a checkered pattern of black and white spaces. The white spaces are the most numerous, with the four corners all being white. The board starts off empty.

The players are Black and White, with Black going first. Each has a supply of stones in her color that fit the board spaces.

On a turn, a player takes one of the following two actions:


Drop a stone of her color onto a black space — a stone may never be entered in a white space.



Shift a stone of her color already on the board a single space orthogonally — in other words, move a stone from a black space into a neighboring white space.


The winner is the first player to get five of her stones in a row horizontally or vertically, or four stones in row diagonally on white spaces. Stones on black spaces cannot win with a diagonal line.

Optional rule: Players may decide to help mitigate Black's first move advantage by adopting a rule prohibiting Black from winning with the easier B-W-B-W-B orthogonal line and only allowing Black to win with the harder W-B-W-B-W orthogonal line.

boardgame.name: Fate SRD: Fate CORE
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Grab your plasma rifles, spell components, and jetpacks! Name your game; Fate Core is the foundation that can make it happen. Fate Core is a flexible system that can support whatever worlds you dream up. Have you always wanted to play a post-apocalyptic spaghetti western with tentacle monsters? Swords and sorcery in space? Wish there was a game based on your favorite series of books, film, or television, but it never happened? Fate Core is your answer.

Fate Core is a tabletop roleplaying game about proactive, capable people who lead dramatic lives. The type of drama they experience is up to you. But wherever they go, you can expect a fun storytelling experience full of twists…of fate.

boardgame.name: Fate SRD: Fate Accelerated
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fate Accelerated, or FAE, is a condensed version of Fate Core that brings all the flexibility and power of Fate in an easily digestible—and quickly read—package. With FAE, you and your friends can step into the world of your favorite books, movies, and TV or you can create a world of your own. And set up is simple—you can be playing in minutes. Whether you’re new to RPGs or an expert gamer, FAE brings something special to the table.

Fate Accelerated Edition. Your story—full speed ahead.

boardgame.name: Fate SRD: Fate Condensed
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fate Condensed is a compact, stand-alone version of the Fate Core System streamlined for clarity and ease of reference. Fate Condensed gives you easy-to- digest rules in as few pages as possible, letting you get to the table and roll the dice, fast. It includes a few simple refinements to the Fate Core engine honed over a decade of active play and development. And best of all, it’s 100% compatible with every one of our 90+ Fate products already published.

boardgame.name: Jojo's Bizarre Adventure FATE
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure FATE is an expansion on the rules of FATE Core that allows players to take part in the fantastic and fabulous word of Jojo’s. If you are new to FATE powered games we strongly recommend that you read FATE Core before attempting to GM this game. However, to help we have included a FATE Core rules quick reference at the end.

boardgame.name: FATE Roleplaying: Strange Fate Slap-dash SRD
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Greetings and welcome to the Strange Fate Slap-dash SRD!

Strange Fate was originally authored by Mike Olson and used as the rules engine for Arc Dream Publishing's Victorian super-steam-punk setting The Kerberos Club.

Though Kerberos Club is a fantastic setting, many of us fans felt it only scratched the surface of what the rules set was capable of. Strange Fate was a fast, flexible incarnation of the Fate engine that could be easily adapted to almost any genre.

To that end, I have created this SRD which contains the open-content rules portion of The Kerberos Club (FATE Edition). I have attempted to remove all references to the setting of Kerberos, even going so far as to re-write one or two sentences to make the rules feel more generic.

boardgame.name: Medicine on the Path: A Disability Supplement For The Witcher Pen & Paper
boardgame.description:
"This supplement is designed to aid you in roleplaying in a sensitive manner and actively encourages you to tailor
any of the features contained within to better represent your own experiences. Be aware that this PDF doesn't cover all disabilities, chronic illnesses, and neurodivergencies. Disability is a spectrum, not a monolith.
You don't have to use all the features listed under a disability. You can choose which ones best represent your experience and disregard those that don't. It is designed to be unique to you and your character(s).
For GMs and players alike, there are sections that advise you with roleplaying tips, how to engage with disability at your table(s) in a sensitive manner, and even disabled NPCs that you can use in your own games."
-Author description, inside cover.

boardgame.name: The Combat Wheelchair
boardgame.description:
This sourcebook provides rules for the combat wheelchair along with upgrades and maintenance. This supplement also introduces a new class, the Łowca, a fierce warrior class undergoing monstrous mutations. Archtypes, subclasses, backgrounds, and NPCs of the disabled who continued their adventuring path. Disabilities does not spell the end of adventuring and this sourcebook provides the means to represent disabilities in the adventuring world.
-- User Summary

boardgame.name: Najeźdźcy ze Scytii: reDrewno Insert
Raiders of Scythia: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Insert for Raiders of Scythia

boardgame.name: Deus: Token Set
boardgame.description: Wooden token set accessory designed for Deus containing 20 of each of Wood, Brick, Grain, and Stone.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Bob's Burgers – Quickplay Edition
boardgame.description: Grill your friends and family's knowledge of TV's fast food-slinging family with TRIVIAL PURSUIT: Bob's Burgers! With 600 questions spanning over nine seasons of the Fox series crude humor and random antics. Players are tested to answer questions from six categories such as The Belchers, Food, Wagstaff School, Songs and Music, Townies and Who Said It to serve up the win alongside a Burger of the Day called the "Bob-B-Que and A".

boardgame.name: Dust to Dust
boardgame.description:
Dust to Dust is a competitive deckbuilding and disintegration game set in a reclaimed world.

In the game, you grew up on an Island in the sky. But they didn’t tell you it was falling into the gene-splicing black sand of the Dust until you became a Diver. Now you race other Divers through the Dust itself, retrieving all the fusion shards you can to be the one who restores your Island to the sky.

To win, you’ll need help from allies recruited from the creatures who still dwell on Urth, like the plant-animal hybrid Biofauna, the newly sentient Machina, or the fearsome remains of humanity called the Colony.

Gameplay
Players draft cards from a market by purchasing them with starting energy coin cards
Players play actions (Allies) from their hand after adding them to their decks, leading to combos
Players also interact with each other by attacking or defending with their actions (Allies)

When the Final Race is triggered, each player takes one more turn, besides the player who triggered it. Fusion Shards are then counted up by each player according to diamond icons on their Relics, Fusion Fragments, and Allies.

The winner is the Diver who accumulates the most fusion shards across their acquired Relics, Fusion Fragments, and Allies.

boardgame.name: Moritat of the Turbo Lover
boardgame.description:
From the description:

«O people, come and hear me speak,
this story true, but ghastly bleak,
'bout the pitiless chase and brutal slaughter,
of the man who seduced King Fathmu's daughter!»

This album crawl takes you on a murderous romp through the night, set to the soothing and slightly synthetic sounds of Judas Priest's «Turbo».

Presented in the style of an old murder ballad, this adventure features:

- a morally «ambiguous» quest, promising dark and bountiful rewards
- a cast of lovely queer NPCs
- rules for fighting on motorcycles and motorcycles in general, with a couple different models to choose from
- monster statblocks for a fire giant & armed automata, with lots of unique robots
- a bunch of illustrations
- two battlemaps

boardgame.name: Shadow Kitty
Shadow*Kitty
boardgame.description: Play as wonderful witches who must work together to free their friendly familiars from the confines of the Cursed Clock! Break their curse by speaking enchanting spell combinations, like Sniffer*Whiffer, Trash*Pigeon & Fluffy*Nightmare! Create chains of four unique spells to save your cute critters before the clock strikes THIRTEEN... but beware, with every error, the clock ticks ever closer to sealing them in forever!

boardgame.name: Rise and Decline of a Galactic Imperium
boardgame.description:
Rise and Decline of a Galactic Imperium was inspired by both Consim Press´ The Hunters and Decision Games´ Struggle for the Galactic Empire, though the former served more of a scrib sheet of what to copy while the latter served as an example of how NOT to do it. Other influences include "Sid Meier´s Alpha Centauri" and "Babylon 5", and surely many others, but those are the big ones.

As a solitaire wargame, the player leads his nation through up to 60 turns of three different "ages" of a nations history, from the Rise, to the period of highest power, down to the inevitable fall from inside and outside sources. Each turn the player will encounter random events, diplomatic conundrums, great battles and economic dilemma, always wondering which action to invest into during this and future turns.

The game ends once the the 20th, 40th or 60th turn has been played, depending on the scenario the player chose at the start of their game.

Players win by accumulating enough victory points to gain at least a marginal victory, the amount needed for each scenario is detailed in the manual.

boardgame.name: North Berkeley
boardgame.description:
The year is 2018. New technology brings unprecedented prosperity to the East Bay, and with it, a crushing housing crisis. The North Berkeley BART station parking lot has emerged as a potential site for new housing, but there are many disagreements over density, affordability, and cost.

It’s a challenge that new leaders rise to. As you assemble your political coalition, will you be the one that meets the greatest number of constituent goals, and goes on to govern North Berkeley?

Based on the real life debate over development at the North Berkeley BART parking lot, North Berkeley is a fast-paced game of negotiation where you take the role of a local interest groups and work out a plan that meets as many of your groups’ goals as possible.

boardgame.name: Froth It!
boardgame.description:
Inspired by attempting to create beautiful latte art at home during lockdown, and failing miserably, Froth It is a knockout climbing game in which players compete to be the first to play their 15 card or the last player standing.

Each player is given a number 15 card and dealt a hand of 7 cards. The deck features numbered Latte Art cards (1-14), +1 wild cards and action cards. The first person to play a number 1 in the centre begins the game.

On your turn you can do one of the following:
- Play as many Latte Art cards as you like (in a run)
- Play a single action card (there are 4 types in the game)
- Refresh your hand - flip your 15 card to record that you have done this, you can only do this once per round, if you need to do this again you are knocked out of the round.

At the end of each turn, players redraw to 7 cards as necessary. The first player to reach 15 on their turn or the last player standing, wins the round. The first player to win 2 rounds wins the game!

Roast the competition by playing clever combinations of Latte Art and action cards that get you to 15 first or knock others out.

Can you be the last barista standing, or the first to froth it like it’s hot?

boardgame.name: Atlantic Crossing
boardgame.description:
A ship-racing game where 3-6 players secretly-bid matchsticks in order to move from the start (Plymouth) to the finish (The Statue of Liberty). Players who bid the same as one or more others will not move, those that bid uniquely will forge across the ocean and those who bid 'zero' can replenish their hand of matchsticks...all bids are 'spent', you see!

Each round, a weather card is revealed to adjust the weather chart: from dangerously-stormy to beautiful and bright, which can - at the extremes - affect the movement of ships. In addition, each card has an Event that can hamper or benefit the ships on their journey including an iceberg and a school of whales that forces all players to sail around it in a loop!

The first player to make it to The Statue of Liberty is the winner!

boardgame.name: Moxie: A Journey of Monsters
boardgame.description:
Fraywick, the last great human city, is constantly under threat by the dangerous wild monsters of the world. But when Fraywick would fall, the Moxian Guard stands tall against the menace. Using the charismatic power of Moxie, the Moxian Guard command their own monsters to fend off threats from beyond the gates. You have discovered your own Moxie, and set off on a journey to rally your own band of monsters together. Tryouts for the Moxian Guard begin in eight weeks, do you have what it takes to make the cut?

Moxie: A Journey of Monsters is played over a series of 8 rounds, culminating in a final tournament between the players. Each round has two phases, a scouting phase in which players search various decks of cards, called routes, for monsters to recruit to their team, and a battle phase where they will face off against another player, pitting their recruited monsters against one another for rewards.

In the scouting phase, there are no turns. Instead, players act simultaneously, scouting routes they've reached. Players begin with just a handful of moxie tokens, which they'll spend to scout these routes. Players can search each deck they've reached one time each round, choosing only a single card from it to join their team, and so must choose how best to spend their moxie tokens to cover the most ground. By committing many moxie tokens to a route, players draw more cards from that route, giving them more options to choose from, but at the cost of less moxie to search other routes with. Once each player has spent all of their moxie tokens for the round, the game proceeds to the battle phase.

In the battle phase, players pair off against each other to pit their team against the others. Each player prepares their team for battle by determining the order they'll send their monsters out, attempting to position each monster where it will best counter their opponents. Once players have committed their order, the battle begins, with players sending their monsters out one at a time to do battle until they run out of strength. Monsters strength is determined by that monsters particular strength dice, by comparing monsters types to see if one or the other can score a critical hit, and by utilizing the various effects of each monster to further alter the outcome. Once only one player has any monsters remaining, they win the battle that round.

After each battle phase, players are rewarded based on their performance. Players who win their battle progress along the route tracker, opening up a new route for them to scout going forward in future rounds. Players who lose their battle, on the other hand, are rewarded additional moxie tokens to allow them to scout further into the routes they've already reached. In addition, defeated players may advance one of their monsters into a powerful new form, granting it new strengths and abilities.

Play continues in this way until the end of the eighth round, where players will compete in a final tournament bracket to determine the games final victor.

boardgame.name: Tassar & Morrhår (2nd Ed)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The second edition of the game with improvements in game flow, consistency and structure.

boardgame.name: Colony Builder
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

COLONY BUILDER is a supplement for the Cepheus Engine roleplaying game and the HOSTILE setting.

Build a colony within the HOSTILE setting. Build a colony from your favourite SF movie or TV show. Make it pay. Keep your costs low. And then test in the market. How will it fare with a key group of characters at the helm? Make decisions for them as they try to fix the colony's inevitable problems, chart the fate of your creation into glory or ignominy. And then watch the corporation come in to take your profits!

Colony Builder provides easy-to-use tools that players need to create their own living and breathing extrasolar colonies. Take a budget and spend it wisely, and keep in mind your environment – every world is potentially hostile! Once built, your players can take up the roles of key personnel and get to manage the fledgling colony, leading the colonists in the struggle against hunger, air-loss, earthquakes, alien parasites and more…

The book covers the origins of colonial projects and which organizations are responsible for its creation, planning and inception. It includes a dozen useful vehicles and robots (including tree logging machines, hunter-killer seadrones and 4-legged excavators). It also features detailed information on the requirements of humans which can be used to extrapolate all kinds of other situations and provide the referee with the tools we used to create the colony building rules.

boardgame.name: The Gods Left It Behind
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Archeologists have been studying the primitive natves on the jungle world of Eniran. These natives have carved cities out of the thick jungle there. According to the native legends a god like race lives in a castle in the clouds above them. At first the archeologists thought that this was just native superstition but recently they discovered that there is, indeed, a castle floating in the clouds.

One of the archeologists offers to pay the travelers to accompany him on an expedition to this castle and find out who built it.

boardgame.name: Once Upon a Crime Part Two
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So you’re Made Men now… Soldiers for the Moran Syndicate, working directly for Sylvester Moran and his recently returned daughter, Cindy. And what exactly does a Syndicate Soldier do on the red streets of Tharsis? Perhaps you’ll be stealing medical supplies from the Corps to sell on the black market… and maybe you will be dragged into a crescendo of events that will lead to war on the streets! A Syndicate War between your faction, the Morans, and their greatest rivals, The White Syndicate! Regardless of the outcome Mars will never be the same.”

A Dark Stars starting adventure for 2-6.
Meet colourful characters.
Be part of the criminal underworld of the Martian City of Tharsis.

boardgame.name: Practical Panache
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pathfinder Second Edition brings a ton of cool classes and options to the table, and the Pathfinder Advanced Player's Guide (Second Edition) brought back the swashbuckler class, a fantastic finesse fighter with a ton of useful skills and styles. PF2 veteran Sasha Laranoa Harving has created a heaping helping of new options, with 10 new swashbuckler styles from the debonair Dashing Doctor to the wall-crawling Scaffolder and the caped Matador. On top of that, they've created 10 killer class feats for the swashbuckler, from Boxer's Bravado and Cape Expert to Innovative Attacks and Animal Pal!

boardgame.name: Silex and the city
boardgame.description:
The year is 40,000 B.C. The entire world seems to obey the laws of natural selection. Well, not entirely... One small valley of indomitable cavemen still holds out against the idea of progress.
Having no idea is the best idea!
Progress is fake news! Evolution is what's leading humanity to its demise, and that's a fact! Thankfully, a small group of enlightened cave-dwellers sees things as they really are... Help the Dotcom family avoid the plague of new ideas, the fate of humanity is at stake!

Make the best use of your cards... to invent as little as possible!

boardgame.name: Sacrifice 666
boardgame.description:
In Sacrifice 666 you play as a clandestine cult and you’re about to summon your Dark Lord.
However, you can’t really seem to agress on who exactly it is you worship. To make matters even worse, you only have one Necronomicon….so you’re going to have to share.

The goal of the game is to sacrifice enough “people” to summon your Dark Lord to the mortal realm before those other misguided fools do.

Sacrifice is an easy to play card game. The rules are light but the humor is heavy !

boardgame.name: Gormiti Versus
Gormiti Versus
Μονομαχιες στο Gorm
boardgame.description:
In Gormiti Versus, each player chooses a Gormiti Warrior and picks a fight with other Invincible Lords of Nature on the island of Gorm.

Each character has its one set of battle tiles. Each turn, two of these tiles are chosen to perform two actions. You can attack, defend, move or even regenerate.

Each successful attack means that 2 or 3 hit points are lost. A warrior whose hit points reach 0 is eliminated. The last warrior standing is victorious.

boardgame.name: Silk Road Adventures
boardgame.description:
As a merchant of the silk road at the center of the world, your goal is to buy and sell specialty goods while moving from one bustling city to the next in order to become a wealthy merchant. In this game, players must create trade routes connecting two cities by lining up tiles containing images of roads on top of the board while using a rough map for hints. After creating trade routes, you must compare them with more precise maps. If there are specialty goods on the routes you create, you can collect points. However, there are certain goods which can deduct points as well, so you must be careful when constructing routes. In addition, you only have two minutes to create the routes. Within the limited time frame, think of the best possible routes and aim to trade well and efficiently.

The game is played in rounds. After first using the trade cards to decide the destination city and value of the local goods, the hourglass is then set, and trading begins. You then refer to your personal specialty goods map while you quickly place route tiles to connect cities together. The fastest merchants, and the merchants that have traveled the most routes will be award with bonuses. At the end, answer keys are placed on top, the goods obtained are confirmed, and points are received. After repeating this four times, the traders that have gotten the most points are the winner.

Require the core game.

Seinsei Pack contains 6 new ninjas to upgrade your game!

Join an all-out dice brawl and prove you’re the best ninja in Konoha village!

Naruto Ninja Arena is the first game using the Roll & Clash system. During the game, you throw your dice as quickly as you can and use the results to activate Techniques without stopping the game. Everyone plays at the same time in a frantic battle to be the last Ninja Standing!

The game ends when all players are K.O. or eliminated except one. The last player standing wins the game!

Ninjas:
Kakashi
Gai
Orochimaru
Tsunade
Jiraiya
3rd Hokage Sarutobi

boardgame.name: Mon: Emblemas de Sengoku
Mon: Emblemi del Sengoku
Mon: Emblems from Sengoku
boardgame.description:
In Mon, players take turns playing cards in numerical order, fighting to receive the points of the cards in play. It's important to respect the order as much as possible, or other players might steal your points! At the end of the game, the player with the most points will be the winner.

The game proceeds with players taking turns, starting with the first player. On their turn, each player must play, change or discard a card. When done, the turn passes to the next player on the left. This proceeds until the game is over.

The game ends when someone runs out of cards and the game has gone one round from there. The player with the highest score wins the game.

boardgame.name: Ať žijí rytíři!
boardgame.description:
Based on the comedy film, Ať žijí rytíři! ("Long live the knights!") is a tower defense game with 2 levels of difficulty - one for children age 7-12 and the other, more advance version, for gamers age 12 and up.

Each round has 6 phases that are repeated until the end of the game is triggered.
Phase 1: Taking action card. Every player takes 6 action cards in the first round, in other rounds takes 3.
Phase 2: Evil knights are coming. The number of evil knights depends on the number of players. In the first round number of evil knights is the same as the number of players + two extra more, in other rounds without two extra more.
Phase 3: Playing action cards. Players use their cards to fight the evil knights. On their turn, players can play as many cards as they can. Players place their cards under evil knights, face down, and put a token in their color on top of it.
Phase 4: Action card payment. Action cards are turned face up (tokens must remain on the cards) and players pay the sum of their face up cards. If they can't pay, all of their face up cards are discarded. If they pay more than necessary, they don't get any money back.
Phase 5: Fighting knights. Evaluate every knight separately. If the sum of the action cards under a knight is greater than the power of the knight, a knight is defeated and the player gets a point. If the sum of the action cards is lower, knight survives (card is not discarded), action cards are discarded and tokens are returned to the player.
Phase 6: Knights attacking. Every knight that survived is going to attack the castle. Every knight attack after another. A knight can destroy a castle card only if his crest color matches the color of the castle card. This card is then discarded.

After 7 rounds, if all the castle cards are destroyed, all players lose. If all the knight cards are used and the castle is still standing, you successfully defended the castle. All players are considered heroes, but only the player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: The Dread Wyrm Egg Hunt
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:';'

This scenario has been designed to throw a new group of players playing first-level heroes straight into a quest playable in a single 3-4 hour session, though there is scope to make it a much longer experience if desired.

boardgame.name: Blade Runner: The Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

This is the BLADE RUNNER roleplaying game – a neon-noir wonderland that’ll take your breath away. One way or another. An evocative world of conflicts and contrasts that dares to ask the hard questions and investigate the powers of empathy, the poisons of fear, and the burdens of being human during inhumane times. An iconic and unforgiving playground of endless possibilities that picks you up, slaps you in the face, and tells you to wake up.

Time to live. Or time to die.

boardgame.name: Rotor
boardgame.description:
Each player starts with a pawn at space A and one on space B. Movement is determined by a die. If a pawn gets on an occupied space, the pawn which was standing there is thron out and has to begin anew at the nearest starting space.

The pawns win points by getting on spaces while meeting certain conditions (color and number of the space, result of the die roll and the position of the second pawn) shown at the table at the bottom of the game board. If a pawn scores points on a space, while throwing out another pawn, the player of that pawn loses the same amount of points.

If a pawn gets on the space with the designation "Wunschfeld" the player gets to chose the color and number of this space for scoring points. The "Wunschfeld" must be abandoned the next turn. No pawn may be thrown out while standing on this space.

The first player to get 200 points wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the magazine "Neue Berliner Illustrierte" Nr. 28/75.

boardgame.name: Blade Runner 2049
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The world of Blade Runner has changed since its original incarnation. The environment has deteriorated faster and faster, whilst technology has grown more and more prevalent. Nine planets have now been colonised, whilst Replicants are once again in production after the catastrophe they caused over two decades ago. To those at the top of the world, these are all grave concerns. But for your average man making his way in life in Los Angeles, it’s just another day in the life.

boardgame.name: 異界/境界/鉄道旅行 (Another World / Another Realm / Rail Travel)
boardgame.description:
You have been reincarnated in this multidimensional realm as a travel writer. You and your fellow passengers ride on the Black Comet, an inter-dimensional railroad that connects all worlds.

We will survey sightseeing attractions and interview passengers to write travel articles. The reporter who publishes the most travel articles will make a name for themselves in this world.

In 異界/境界/鉄道旅行 (Another World / Another Realm / Rail Travel), you bid on passengers who appear each round using your dice. Not only do you have to outbid your opponents, you want enough dice to make a successful roll to acquire the passenger’s sightseeing cards. You also compete with other players for souvenirs. Specific sets of cards are used to publish articles, the main source of points at the end of the game. You can earn additional points for each passenger card you acquire, and some passengers earn bonus points with specific articles. After 5 rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

The game features a beautifully illustrated cast of characters riding on the Black Comet. All of the passenger, sightseeing, and souvenir cards are unique, with imaginative text that hints at a bigger story. Among the original ideas are references to folklore and popular media. This is a game with high production values, great art, and fun gameplay.

boardgame.name: Hideout: Face your fears
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Play as May and try to save your brother.User Summary

Build your settlement and create a wonderful place for your people in this free-to-play relaxing game.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Live Free or Die: Tabletop Battles of the American Revolution
boardgame.description:
Live Free or Die is a fast-playing set of rules for wargaming the most famous battles of the American War of Independence on the tabletop.

This is a 4-page system designed for army-level command.
The basic maneuver element is a regiment, comprised of multiple bases.
The mechanics of the game emphasize the role of heroic leaders and the differences in training/quality between the regiments involved.
Because the booklet is so short, the print version of Live Free or Die is presented in magazine-style with glossy pages that look and feel like a standard magazine.

This booklet includes the rules, designer notes, and historical scenarios for Princeton, Germantown, & Camden.

–Description from the publisher

boardgame.description:

Buy derelict real estates, turn them and sell them.User Summary

boardgame.name: Keep It 100
boardgame.description:
Of 100 bodybuilders that we polled, how many do you think said “yes” to the question “Do you drink more than 3 alcoholic drinks a week?" 25%? 50%? Higher? More importantly: is the number of bodybuilders who said yes HIGHER or LOWER than the number of 100 romance novel readers who said they believed in love at first sight?

In Keep It 100, up to eight players take turns looking at survey questions, and trying to predict how different types of people answered – how many said yes or no.

On your turn, you’ll take on the role of Slider, guessing WHERE your question cards slide into the ever-growing line of questions and answers. Will the hidden numbers on your cards be higher or lower than the numbers already in front of you?

Players win the game by correctly playing their survey cards into a lineup of other cards on the table. For example, if the line currently features cards with answers of 22, 44, and 75. The active player must correctly guess where the card from the hand would slot in that line of answers without actually knowing how many people said "yes" to their survey first.

The fun’s not limited to just one person. Each round, all the other players ALSO predict whether or not the Slider’s guesses are correct.

The free-for-all fun ends when all the cards are played and all the points are tallied, to see who’s REALLY kept it 100 (or more)!

boardgame.name: Incredibox
boardgame.description:
A fun, interactive music experience

Incredibox is a music app that lets you create your own music with the help of a merry crew of beatboxers. Choose your musical style among 8 impressive atmospheres and start to lay down, record and share your mix.

Where making music is child's play!

Part game, part tool, Incredibox is above all an audio and visual experience that has quickly become a hit with people of all ages. More than 70 million players worldwide have already enjoyed it. The right mix of music, graphics, animation and interactivity makes Incredibox ideal for everyone. And because it makes learning fun and entertaining, Incredibox is now being used by schools all over the world.

Create a mix

Drag and drop icons onto the avatars to make them sing and start to compose your own music. Find the right sound combos to unlock animated choruses that will enhance your tune.

Share it

Once your composition sounds great, just save it and you will get a link to your mix. You can easily share it with anybody so they can listen and even vote for it.

Be a legend

If you share your mix a lot and get enough votes from other users, you may go down in Incredibox history by joining the Top 50 chart. Ready to show your stuff?

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Heirs to the Shogunate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Centuries ago, the tumultuous Dragon-Blooded Shogunate ruled much of the known world. Its glory and grandeur fell into ashes amid the Great Contagion, but today new empires blaze high from its embers.

Haughty Dynasts feasting amid the stolen treasures of the Threshold; proud Seventh Legion officers clad in panoplies of jade; lone outcastes struggling to carve out a heroic legend at the world’s edge — they’re all heirs to the Shogunate, yet they each stand on their own as a prince of the earth.

Heirs to the Shogunate details the Realm’s cadet houses and secondary schools, the military city-state of Lookshy, Prasad’s expanding empire, the weird Forest Witches, and outcastes. It also contains new Dragon-Blooded Charms, heirloom artifacts, and Quick Characters. Lastly, it describes the impending Realm Civil War, including a fully playable scenario depicting the War in the West.

boardgame.name: Rackham Vale: Fantasy Adventure from the Art of Arthur Rackham
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the world was one hundred years younger, during the Golden Age of British Book Illustration, Arthur Rackham and his paint box gave birth to some of the most transportive, iconic, and magical images of all time. His work brought to life characters and settings from famous fairy tales, ancient mythology, and timeless classics.

In Rackham Vale these images are given new life for use in your tabletop role-playing games. Rackham’s characters, creatures, and scenes become NPCs, villains, and a hidden-vale, sandbox setting that can be dropped into any RPG campaign that could do with a touch of magic, mystery, and old-time weirdness.

In addition to high adventure, weird creatures, dark sorcery, and oodles of riddling, tricksy, ribald fairy folk, you’ll find:

152 pages and 100+ Rackham illustrations.
An original map by Joe N. Brown.
An original factions graphic that charts relationships for easy reference.
Dozens of adventure hooks.
A fully illustrated bestiary of 24 new creatures based on Rackham's artwork.
Tables for generating new settlements and creatures that fit the setting.
A preparation checklist for GMs.
Content that prioritizes accessibility and utility.
Stats for OSE, although the setting is compatible with and easily adapted to other systems.

listing.notes: This book is brand new but has slight prior shipping damage to the back cover. Photo available on request (it is minor but did need to be mentioned). Comes with postcard of Rackham Vale.

boardgame.name: Shaolia: Emerald Sea
boardgame.description:
A promo pack from the Shaolia: Great Houses Kickstarter that came free with most of the pledge tiers. It contains a promo 1v1 scenario, 16 Lv2 cards, 2 character cards, and 2 quest cards.

4x Coastal Defense Post
4x Coral Reef Habitat
4x Patrol Boat
4x Pearl Divers

2 quests (they don't have names, they're just two additional quests to add when playing with the Great Houses expansion)

2 Characters - Navigator & Witch Doctor

It also came with a little paper booklet that tells you about the new promo scenario and any rules that the promo pack adds.

boardgame.name: Dragon+ (Issue 39 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wild Beyond the Witchlight is now available! Enjoy our deeper dives into its Feywild art, Strixhaven’s mascots, and Fizban’s scary mind flayer and beholder dragons!

boardgame.name: Wild Realms
boardgame.description:
The ancient civilizations of humanity are forgotten. Nature has reclaimed the world. Now is the Age of Animals. The Wild-lands stand unknown...unsettled...but with the dangerous and untamed, also comes beauty and wonder. The stunning vista of the Realms is yours to discover! Search out the Four Realms—the refreshing winds of Air, the lush forests of Land, the rushing waves of Water and the burning chasms of Fire. Quest with Animal allies into these untamed places and establish a new Kingdom of Animals within the Wild Realms!

In this competitive game, 2-4 players draw 5-cards into their hand and use them to "build" their Kingdom by playing the Four Realms (Air, Land, Water, Fire) and Animals to defend them.

Players play their cards each turn in four phases: Unleash a Legendary Animal, Play Realm cards and Animals to defend them, Attack opponents to "knockout" their defenders and activate Animal allies' special abilities , Move Animals between Realms and Alliances in your Kingdom, and "Lock" Realm(s).

During the Attack phase, if a player feels the need (they are "behind" or just feeling lukcy) and have at least one "locked" Realm, they may engage in a risky "Realm Duel.".

A player wins (and the game ends) if they are the first to lock all Four Realms (Air, Land, Water, Fire) thereby completing their Kingdom.

Your Animal allies stand ready! Will you be the first to raise a new Animal Kingdom out of the Wild Realms?

boardgame.name: A Brazen Crown
boardgame.description:
A Brazen Crown is the first card game based on Mörk Borg, a pitch-black apocalyptic fantasy RPG set in a bleak and dying world.

A Brazen Crown is a lightning-fast battle card game with strong drafting options. Each player controls a blended deck from two of five iconic factions (Royal, Occultist, Esoteric, Fanged & Scum) and wins by reducing their opponent's health points to zero.

On their turn, a player has three coins to spend on minions, spells, relics and traps from their hand. While the ultimate goal is to deal damage to the opponent, other card abilities include wounding or healing minions, searching for other cards, gaining loot to be spent on later turns, and so on.

A player holding the Brazen Crown card at the end of their turn is able to draw an extra card; however, this also increases the misery of the world. The game instantly ends if seven miseries are summoned, with the triggering player losing. Uneasy is the head...

boardgame.name: Empire in Ruins Companion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Empire in Ruins Companion is the fifth and final of our five-part series of companion volumes to the Enemy Within campaign. The essential companion to campaigning in a shattered Empire is packed with supplementary material to not only expand Empire in Ruins but also provide an indispensable guide to any WFRP games set within the fractured nation.

Empire in Ruins Companion includes:


Alternative Empires, features the ramifications of the fulfilment of the ambitions of Yann Zuntermein, Karl-Heinz Wasmeier, or the late Kastor Lieberung.
More Madcraw, the Night Goblins and their depredations return with more details on this extraordinary remote tribe, including several new tribe members that might trouble any adventurers who stray into their territory.
The Place of the Shining Rock, more details and fascinating lore on this sacred site holy to both Sigmar and Ulric, its storied past and geography.
Altdorf in Chaos, highlights the several unusual phenomena that could occur in the Crown of the Empire as the Enemy Within nears its thrilling climax.
The Imperial Ostlanders, who are these brave frontier folk, ably commanded by Reikhardt Mathis Sievers, and what part might they play in Empire in Ruins?
The Nordland Question, during the Turmoil that shakes the Empire, many provincial areas make a play for greatness at this time. Nordland’s history and notable personalities show rebellion was inevitable sooner or later.
The Siege of Diesdorf, under the looming threat of the Red Crown, can the Diesdorf Council keep their town in good order?
The Bigger They Are… An Ogre as a judicial champion means most trials are decided before they begin.
The Triumph of the Gravelord: Will the Gravelord (everyone’s favourite self-obsessed Necromancer) who has stalked the Characters since Death on the Reik, achieve supremacy?

boardgame.name: ARK: Primal Survival
boardgame.description:
The playing experience will differ depending on which creature the player is taking control of. As a Raptor, players can communicate and coordinate tactical attacks on other species. As a Titanomyrma the focus is on survival against the elements and building a thriving colony centered around ant hills.

planned for release in February 2017, but is currently delayed until an unknown date.

boardgame.name: Crime Story: Stockholm
boardgame.description:
During the festivities surrounding the Nobel Prize ceremony, a mysterious murder occurs in Stockholm's Vasa Museum. What happened? What was the motive? And most importantly - who is behind the attack?

In 60 minutes, the players try to find out together what happened and who committed the crime. They decide which traces they want to follow and which they do not want to consider. Clues must be interpreted correctly and secrets must be uncovered.

boardgame.name: Crime Story: London
boardgame.description:
At the famous Shakespeare Festival at the London Globe, the lead actor of Hamlet, Calvin Redgrave, has disappeared without a trace - hours before the most important performance of the year! What has happened? Who is involved? And most importantly, where is Calvin?

In 60 minutes, the players try to find out together what happened and who committed the crime. They decide which traces they want to follow and which they do not want to consider. Clues must be interpreted correctly and secrets must be uncovered.

boardgame.name: Selfie Fox
boardgame.description:
3-6 players compete against each other in various challenges based on the theme of the selfie.
The players use spinner to determine the category of the round.
Players move their standees around the board determining a word, which they either act out as a selfie (still frame), boomerang (pantomime without any aids), or challenge (detailed on a challenge card they draw). The other players have to guess the word. Players then will be rewarded with victory point cards, which can have a variety of possible, even negative numbers. The first player with a certain amount of victory points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Tokyo Highway 2 + 4 Kit
boardgame.description:
This is an upgrade kit for 2-player Tokyo Highway (2016) and 4-player Tokyo Highway (2018) to make a 6-player version of Tokyo Highway.

Adds 2 extra buildings and sets of 10 green and purple cars.

Requires the road and pillar components from the 2-player version and all the components of the 4-player version to play. Or just use as alternative colored cars for your 2-4 players games!

listing.notes: New and unopened. I bought this, and then realized that my base game was already 4-player.

boardgame.name: Spillin' Beans: Grandpa-Approved Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: This expansion contains 40 Grandpa-Approved cards in a tuck box. Swap out your dirty cards for these hilarious sanitized cards to play with family and prude friends!

boardgame.name: Större Tassar & Morrhår
boardgame.description: A Swedish standalone RPG contains rules for playing larger animals than in the other Tassar & Morrhår rules, such as cats and dogs. The game also includes a new game world setting, Kvarntuna.
